This sample attributes table contains sample IDs, analyte type, and name of the center which conducted genotyping.

This data table contains a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample source and sample use.
The subject pedigree table contains family ID, subject ID, mother ID, father ID, and sex.

The subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample use.

The data table contains data that were collected from the Concomitant Medications Form (DCM). Variables include medication number and code, indication, if the medication is ongoing, and the duration of the medication.

The data table contains subject data with sample information for the Global Trace Screen (GTV). Variables include the specimen type (based on 18 specimens from 6 body sites), nucleic extraction method, and sample administrative information. The Global Trace dataset will be updated when additional visits or subjects have been added.

The data table contains data that were collected from the Suppplemental Questions Form (DSU) upon the completion of HMP study enrollment. Variables include additional health history such as dietary habits, breastfeeding, birthing history, delivery method, and if the subject failed any initial screenings prior to enrollment.

The Targeted Physical Forms (DTP), Medical History Screening Forms (DHX), and the Visit Documentation Forms (DVD) have been combined into a single data table. The DTP variables include measurements collected for blood pressure, pulse, body weight, height, and BMI. Variables also include physical assessment of areas/systems and the specific details of the abnormalities. Areas/Systems consist of general appearance, HEENT, cardiovascular, pulmonary, abdomen, neurological, musculoskeletal, and extremities. The DHX variables include data that indicate whether the subject noted medical problems in various areas/systems and the indications and specifications of medical problems. Areas/Systems consist of HEENT, cardiovascular, pulmonary, GI, hepatobiliary, renal, neurologic, blood lymphatic, endocrine/metabolic, musculoskeletal, genital/reproductive, dermatologic, allergies, cancer, immunodeficiency, drug or alcohol dependence, and autoimmune disease. Data were also collected for relevant medical or surgical history, medical abnormality with ongoing treatment and presence of acute disease. The DVD variables include education level, insurance status, occupation status, tobacco usage, and visit-specific information. This visit-specific information pertains to subject's oral temperature, pregnancy test results, education level, insurance status, occupation, and if blood and GI specimens were collected. DTP, DHX and DVD data will be collected at each visit though not every variable was collected.
Subject - Consent - Information
The subject consent data table contains subject IDs and consent group information.
This registration table contains participant IDs, participant status, protocol number, and ages at study start and at registration.

The physical examination includes abdomen, appearance, blood pressure, cardiovascular, chest lung, ears, extremities, eyes, genitourinary (GU), head, heart rate, height, musculoskeletal, neurological, nose, oximetry, PMI, pectus excavatum, respirations, skin, temperature, throat, and weight.

The CT scoring form includes bronchiectasis, cavities, cylindrical bronchiectasis, cystic bronchiectasis, dilated airways, left and right lower lobes, left upper lobe upper division, lingula, mucoid impaction, right middle lobe, right upper lobe, thickened airway walls, tree-in-bud infiltrates or nodules, and varicose.

The relative questionnaire form includes relative ID, relation of the subject to the proband, parent in common siblings, parent in common maternal aunt or uncle, parent in common paternal aunt or uncle, gender, age, approximate age at death if deceased, cause of death, if the relative has been diagnosed with bronchiectasis, fertility history (children number, spontaneous abortion, elective abortion, fertility assistance, any child with respiratory illness), situs abnormalities, retinitis pigmentosa, polycystic kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis or other rheumatologic or connective tissue disease, marfan syndrome or related disorder, any other genetic illnesses, sinopulmonary symptoms (allergic rhinitis, asthma, bronchiectasis, chronic cough, chronic nasal congestion, chronic otitis media, chronic siusitis, chronic sputum production, full term at birth, gastro esophageal reflux, nasal polyp, neonatal pneumonia, neonatal respiratory  distress, pectus excavatum, pneumonias/chest infections, pneumothoraces, scoliosis, valvular heart dis), and fertility assistance.

The Demographics Form (DEM) and the Eligibility Checklist (ENR) have been combined into a single data table. The DEM variables include sociodemographic measurements such as gender, ethnicity, race, and place of birth, while the ENR variables include the enrollment/first sampling time of subjects (n=1 variable) and administrative variables (n=4 variables). Both the Medical History and Targeted Physical exams must be completed prior to the completion of the Exclusion Criteria found in the ENR form. Data derived from the Medical History (DHX) and Targeted Physical (DTP) exams can be found in EMMES_HMP_DTP_DHX_DVD dataset.

This subject phenotype table contains subject IDs and primary disease.
This sample attributes table contains sample IDs, sample type, and analyte type.

This data table contains a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample use.

This subject phenotype data table includes the subject's sex, self-reported ethnicity, age at sampling, total cholesterol, HDL-C, triglycerides, LDL-C, and FACS staining for differentiation assessment.

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study patient IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample use.
This pedigree data table contains family relationships in the format of family IDs, subject IDs, father IDs, mother IDs, and sex of subjects.

This subject phenotype data table includes subject's age (at registration, various milestones, baseline tests and follow-up), race, ethnicity, CRIM status, GAA activity, allele 1 and 2, ECG and EKG measurements, milestones (head control, sitting, standing, walking, and jumping), feeding abilities, anthropometric measurements (height, weight, and head circumference), IgG testing, immune modulation medication given, enzyme levels (CK, CK MB isotypes, AST, ALT), and HEX4 biomarker levels.

The dataset provides information about medication taken, duration of Atazanavir treatment, reason for discontinuation - if treatment was not completed, genotype observations (not available on the public site), plus bilirubin and hemoglobin data obtained at different times during treatment, and basic sociodemographic data. Please note that study participants' case-control status refers to 'drug compatibility', i.e. study participants who discontinued the drug regimen because of side effects are considered to be 'cases', while study participants who completed a 12-months Atazanavir regimen are considered to be 'controls'.

The subject sample mapping file contains a mapping of subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for sequencing. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. This table also includes sample use.

Pedigree Information

The dataset provides basic administrative information of specimen collection - please note that the current study release does not include any molecular sample data, however it is expected that other dbGaP studies will provide access to various types of molecular data (e.g. see: EPI 4K,   phs000654 ).

The dataset - 7_10_Diagnostic_Interview_Old_Header - represents data obtained through a detailed diagnostic interview form used at earlier stages of the study. Queried were participants' status and behavior prior to seizures, at time when e.g. status epilepticus or grand mal was experienced, potential triggers of seizures and medication use (current or past).
The dataset provides data describing smaller seizures (SMSZ) and their symptoms, e.g. duration, frequency, type (shaking/jerking/eye flattering) etc.

The dataset provides information about eligibility criteria for study participants included as 'controls', interview questions queried for potential triggers of seizures, e.g. head injuries, infections, medications, stroke, smoking habits etc., and health of family members by asking about presence/absence of diseases such as Alzheimer's, diabetes, hypertension, etc., in relatives.

The dataset provides information about eligibility criteria for study participants included as 'cases'. Interview questiona were aimed to collect information about e.g. diagnosis of epilepsy, number of seizures experienced per lifetime, seizures experienced as a child/adult, and potential triggers of seizures, e.g. head injuries, infections, medications, stroke, etc.

The dataset provides information about study participants' final diagnosis and the data/documents used to obtain the diagnosis (questionnaires, EEG-, MRI records). Data of EEG records, seizure symptoms, seizure type, potential seizure triggers are provided.
The dataset provides detailed data of antiepileptic treatments and can be linked to dataset: 7_13_AED_Header through variable=AEDID.

The dataset describes diagnostic interview data of 'small' seizures experienced (e.g. date of occurrence, experienced while awake/at sleep), and general behavioral status experienced following seizure (body part affected, study participant was able to communicate or not, confused, etc.). The data can be linked to data presented in 7_8_Diagnostic_Interview_Header via variables=DxInterviewID and DX2_SMSZ_NUMBER.

The dataset represents data obtained through a detailed diagnostic interview, querying participants' status and behavior prior to seizures, at the time when seizures were experienced, inquiring about  potential triggers of seizures, and medication that participants take currently, or have taken in the past. Data points described as 'Null' refer to non-cases.
The dataset provides demographic data with focus on ethnicity/race of study participants and family members (newer forms).
The dataset provides demographic data with focus on ethnicity/race of study participants and family members.
The dataset describes antiepileptic treatments and their effectiveness, specifically use of ACTH, ketogenic diet, surgery or vagus nerve stimulation (VNS).
The dataset provides summary data of MRI results.

The subject sample mapping data table contains a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. dbGaP samples are defined as the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample use.

The dataset provides angiogram results of coronary arteries. Existence and condition (i.e. normal/new/worse/same/improved) of aneurisms, stenoses, occlusions, grafts, and angioplasty were determined on descending, main, circumflex, and coronary arteries.

The dataset provides data of ANCA (anti neutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies)-associated damage across the body, including cardiac, digestive, musculoskeletal, neurologic, respiratory, other somatic systems.

The dataset provides angiogram results of axillary, brachial, radial, ulnar, palmar and digital arteries. Existence and condition (i.e. normal/new/worse/same/improved) of aneurisms, stenoses, occlusions, grafts, and angioplasty were determined.
Subject - Consent - Information

The dataset provides angiogram results of celiac, mesenteric and renal arteries. Existence and condition (i.e. normal/new/worse/same/improved) of aneurisms, stenoses, occlusions, grafts, and angioplasty were determined at celiac, superior-/inferior mesenteric arteries, and right/left renal arteries.
The dataset provides information about comorbidities observed at baseline (e.g. embolies, thromboses, herpes, heart diseases, stroke, gastro-intestinal symptoms) and provides ICD9 codes for some.
This pedigree data table includes family relationships in the format of family IDs, subject IDs, father IDs, mother IDs, subject's sex, and monozygotic twin IDs.

The dataset provides angiogram results of anterior, middle, posterior, basilar, vertebral, and common, interior, exterior carotid arteries. The dataset provides angiogram results of aorta and branches. Existence and condition (i.e. normal/new/worse/same/improved) of aneurisms, stenoses, occlusions, grafts, and angioplasty were determined at thoracic root, aortic arch, descending thoracic aorta, common/internal/external carotid arteries, abdominal aorta, vertebral arteries, axillary and subclavian arteries, celiac and superior-/inferior mesenteric arteries, renal, iliac arteries, and superficial, main, deep femoral arteries.
The dataset provides information about medication used at baseline for vasculitis (or Churg-Strauss Syndrome), e.g. if ever received, currently taking, when last used and duration of cumulative use.

The dataset provides information about health survey results obtained at baseline (health status now compared to one year ago), and queries for participants#&39; ability to function independently (e.g. ability to walk, shop, clean, etc.)

The dataset provides results of angiograms of pulmonary arteries. Existence and condition (i.e. normal/new/worse/same/improved) of aneurisms, stenoses, occlusions, grafts, and angioplasty were determined.

The dataset provides information about symptoms experienced during the last 28 days, using the Birmingham Vasculitis Activity Score. Participants were queried about symptoms (new/worse/persistent) across the body (e.g. skin, chest, kidneys, gastro-intestinal, pulmonary areas, etc.).

The dataset provides baseline medical history data that include e.g. descriptions of presence/absence of varies conditions of the cardiovascular, gastro-intestinal, renal, nervous, and reproductive systems at different times: on day of visit, since last visit, during the last 28 days.

This data table contains diagnostic information of Italian and US subjects with diagnosis of ALS (ALS, site of onset) or controls, and provides general sociodemographic information (birthplace, gender, ethnicity). For details, please see: Hum Mol Genet. 2009 Apr 15;18(8):1524-32;  PMID 19193627 ).
Sample Attribute Information
Phenotype data include type of epilepsy observed, gender and ethnicity information.

This table contains ALS phenotype data (n=276) drawn from the NINDS DNA and Cell Line Repository (see The National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS) Human Genetics Resource Center: DNA and Cell Line Repository (the NINDS Repository): Motor Neuron/Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) Study, phs000006). The phenotype information represents unrelated, white, non-Hispanic subjects diagnosed with sporadic ALS (probable, clinically probable, laboratory supported or definite) and no family history of ALS. Study inclusion criteria (e.g. location of onset of symptoms, type of motor neurons involved [upper, lower, bulbar], current treatment and information about genetic tests taken), as well as study exclusion criteria (i.e. identification of information [e.g. electrophysiological or imaging test results, medical or family histories etc.] suggestive of a different and potentially confounding diagnosis), were queried through the NINDS Repository Clinical Data Elements questionnaire for ALS (phd000585).

The dataset provides information about ALS affliction (e.g. type of ALS, age and site of onset), and birth country of study participants. Phenotype, and molecular data of n=15480 study participants are now available through dbGaP.
Pedigree Information

This data table contains information of Italian subjects diagnosed with ALS (n=141, e.g. data of ALS onset site, onset age), and provides general sociodemographic information (birthplace, gender, ethnicity). Data of these subjects and previously released data (version 2) were used for the analysis published in: Proc. Nat. Acad. Sci. USA, 107 (27): 12335-8 (2010),  PMID 20566859 ).

This table contains neurologically normal phenotype data (n=268) taken from the NINDS DNA and Cell Line Repository (see National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke [NINDS] Repository Neurologically Normal Control Collection [phs000004]). This phenotype information represents unrelated, white, non-Hispanic subjects who have been queried with the NINDS Repository Control Clinical Data Elements questionnaire (phd000586); the results describe these subjects to be free of neurological diseases, e.g. ALS, Alzheimer's disease, ataxia, autism, bipolar disorder, brain aneurysm, dementia, dystonia, or Parkinson's disease, and to show a Folstein Mini-Mental State examination score of 26 to 30. These control samples were matched to cases (pht000186) with regard to ethnic origin, but not with regard to age or gender.

This data table contains a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample aliases and sample use.

The data set provides longitudinal phenotype information that was collected over a time period of about 15 years through home and clinic visits; all subjects had been clinically diagnosed with obstructive sleep apnea, and first/second degree relatives and/or spouses where included whenever possible. Questionnaires were designed for adults or children, and queried for a variety of factors relating to sleep disordered breathing, e.g. quality and quantity of sleep (including questions about apnea/narcolepsy), heart and lung function, weight gain/loss, BMI, the presence/absence of other health problems (e.g. allergies, asthma, cancer, diabetes, stroke, etc.), and which family members were affected; subjects' information about use of medication(s) and vitamins, lifestyle choices (smoking, exercising, alcohol consumption, etc.) and evaluation of 'quality of life' and other psychological data (CHQ, ESS, FOS, MOS, SF36) are included. The children's questionnaire also provides information about birth status (premature/full-term), birth weight and maternal behavior during pregnancy (e.g. smoking, alcohol consumption).
The subject consent file includes subject IDs, consent information, and subject aliases.

The subject consent file includes subject IDs, consent information, and subject source.

This data table contains a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample source and sample use.

This sample attributes table contains sample IDs, analyte type, and name of the center which conducted genotyping.
General Medical History: allergies, past illnesses/conditions, and hospitalizations.
Adverse Events (AEs): type of AE, outcome, follow-up, and reporting.
Demographics data table includes ethnicity, gender, and race.
Neurological Exam: mental status, cranial nerves, motor strength, and other reflexes, signs, and sensations.
Clinical Evaluations: EEG findings, eye examination (pupil size and reactivity and saccades), and MRI, rehabilitation, and nutritional evaluations completed.
Vineland Adaptive Behavior Rating Scales (vabs): communication, daily living skills, socialization, and motor skills.
Registration: RDCRN Protocol number, participant status, age in years at registration and start of study.
DNA Sample: diagnosis of MLIV confirmed, date of sample collected, age at sample collection, and analysis completed.
Labs 6704 data table includes a chemistry analysis, CBC, and urinalysis.
Eligiblity: definitive diagnosis of MLIV, sufficient general health, pregnancy and nursing status, informed consent, ability to travel, and age at consent.
General Physical Exam: vital signs, anthropometry, and general assessments using the Tanner scale.
Concomitant medication: status of medications taken currently (name, dose, units, frequency, interval, route, indication, start and stop dates).
Conclusion of Study Participants data table includes participant's completion status, form status and name, participant cycle number and visit, withdrawal status, and reasons for withdrawal.

This subject phenotype data table includes demographic information (n=9 variables; gender, age, race, ethnicty, height, weight, and bmi), study eligibiliy, general medical history (n=21 variables), autoimmune, degenerative, neurological (n=11 variables), evidence of HIV (n=9 variables), blood donation (n=2 variables), information (n=41 variables), potential exposure: physical contact (n=3 variables), potential exposure: sexual activity (n=4 variables), history at time of death (n=13 variables), tissue transplant (n=2 variables), medical history source, death circumstances (n=26 variables), tissue recovery (n=13 variables), serology results (n=14 variables), organ donor or post-mortem cohort, total ischemic time for a donor, brain pH and weight, drinking status (n=6 variables), and smoking status (n=6 variables).

This data table contains a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample source and sample use.

Form 37 - Thoughts and Feelings -- social support; social integration; care giving; social strain; optimism; negative emotional expressiveness; hostility. The Thoughts and Feelings form was collected at baseline for CT and OS, and again at close-out for CT participants. Additional items were added to the form used at close-out. A close-out visit was defined as the participant's annual or semi-annual visit occurring between October 2004 and March 2005.

Form 2 - Eligibility Screen -- name; mailing address; telephone numbers and best times to call; date of birth; residing in area for next three years; current involvement in other research studies; history of cancer (site, diagnosis in past 10 years); ethnicity; recruitment source; hormone use (present, in last three months); osteoporosis-related fracture and hormone use as treatment; hysterectomy history; last menstrual bleeding; number of meals prepared away from home; special diets (type); history of diabetes, deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolus, stroke, transient ischemic attack, myocardial infarction; history of sickle cell anemia, heart failure, liver disease, bleeding problem; loss of 15 pounds in last six months; renal failure requiring hemodialysis; other chronic illness; emotional or mental problems; ability to get to clinical center; interest in DM; interest in HRT (willingness to stop current hormone medications).
All Discovered Death Outcome Detail (Form 124/120) (Main, Ext1, Ext2)
Hysterectomy Outcome Details (Form 131) (Main, Ext1)
Risk Scores (Baseline) - Gail 5 year risk and WHO 10 year probability of fracture/hip fracture

Outcomes - Clinical Trials (CT) + Observational Study (OS) Adjudicated data file. Verified outcomes for OS and CT include all cancers, fractures (all fractures for CT; hip fracture only for OS), and cardiovascular outcomes, except DVT and PE. DVT and PE are only verified for HT participants. The outcomes for which central adjudication is required for all OS and CT participants are hip fracture, in situ breast, invasive breast, colon, endometrium, ovary, rectosigmoid junction and rectum cancers. In addition, for CT participants, central adjudication is required for death. MI, Stroke, DVT, and PE are centrally adjudicated for HT participants only.
Form 301 - WHI Long Life Study Visits (WHI-LLS)
Form 157 - Psychosocial Supplemental Questionnaire (Ext2)
UNC Heart Failure Details (Main, Ext1, Ext2)
HRT Medicaton Adherence (Main)
Form 156 - Eating Habits Supplemental Questionnaire (Ext2)
Form 155 - Lifestyle Questionnaire (Ext2)
Outcomes - Breast Cancer (Form 122/130), data for Calcium and Vitamin D (CaD) Trial
Participant Follow-Up Status History (WHI Main Study and Extension)
CaD Medication Adherence (Main)

Form 33 - Medical History Update of Faints, Falls, Exams, Tests and Procedures -- hospitalization since last contact; hospitalization for heart, circulatory, or coagulation problems; stroke or transient ischemic attack, number of falls or syncopal episodes, fractures update; cancer (type, where diagnosed, hospitalization); mammogram; breast biopsy, needle aspiration, or lumpectomy; tests and procedures; electrocardiogram; diagnosis of new conditions; hip or other joint replacement. This form is also used to manage major health effects and events and to monitor adverse effects. This dataset now also includes data collected from Extension form 33s.

Form 45 - Current Supplements - current supplement name; vitamin and mineral type, dose, frequency, duration. This form was required for all OS participants. Data from Form 45 include daily nutrient intake from multivitamins and single supplements and types of supplements taken. The average intake per day from combination and/or single supplements for 25 nutrients has been calculated. In addition, variables indicating use of any type of supplement, multivitamins with or without minerals, stress tabs or other combination supplements are included.
Specimen Test Results - laboratory specimen analysis results and details
Form 92 - Pap Smear -- type cells present; pathology results; follow-up results

Form 83 - Transvaginal Uterine Ultrasound - endometrial thickness; pathology results; endometrial cavity fluid; follow-up results. This form was not required for OS participants, but was included for OS if available.
Form 35 - Personal Habits Update - physical activity and exercise; alcohol consumption; current cigarette smoking.

Form 34 - Personal Habits Questionnaire -- coffee consumption; smoking history; alcohol history; weight change; special diets; history of physical activity and exercise (frequency, duration). This self-administered questionnaire was required for all OS participants.

Form 32 - Family History Questionnaire -- number of full-blooded sisters and brothers, daughters, and sons; parental age or date of death; relatives' history of' diabetes, myocardial infarction, stroke, cancers; fractures in parents (site, age). This self-administered questionnaire was required for all OS participants.

Form 31 - Reproductive History -- age at menarche; history of menstrual irregularity and amenorrhea; history of menopausal symptoms; history of pregnancy, pregnancy outcomes, infertility; history of breast feeding; history of gynecologic and breast surgeries. This self-administered questionnaire was required for all OS participants.

Form 30 - Medical History Questionnaire -- hospitalization history; history of medical conditions; history of heart, circulatory, or coagulation problems; history of arthritis, gallbladder disease, thyroid disease, hypertension, angina, peripheral arterial disease and related procedures, colonoscopy or sigmoidoscopy, stool guaiac; history of cancers (site, age at diagnosis); recent history of falls or syncopal episodes; history of fractures (site, age, number). This self-administered questionnaire was required for all OS participants.
Form 60 - MyPyramid Equivalents Database (MPEDS) and Healthy Eating Index (HEI) (Baseline, Main)

Form 60 - Food Questionnaire -- Self-administered food frequency questionnaire that assesses group and individual-level intakes of selected nutrients, in particular the proportion of total energy from different macronutrients. Form 60 is a combination of Form 60a - Energy, Macronutrients, Cholesterol, Caffeine, Fiber, Fruits, Vegetables, Glycemic Load. This self-administered questionnaire was required for all OS participants, Form 60b - Vitamins, Minerals and Carotenoids, Form 60c - Individual Starches, Sugars and Amino Acids, Oxalic and Phytic Acid, and Ash, and Form 60d - Individual Fatty Acids and Isoflavones. This self-administered questionnaire was required for all OS participants.
Form 134 - Addendum to Medical History Update -- Parkinson's disease, sugar diabetes or high blood sugar when subject was not pregnant.

Form 48 - Observational Study (OS) Follow-up Questionnaire (Year 1) -- current weight, recent weight change; current food and beverage consumption at meal or snack times, recent use of fats or oils, recent wine consumption; current smoking habits; recent history of hormone replacement; history of insecticide exposure; history of living with pets; history of computer use (frequency, duration); history of hand-held hair dryer use (frequency, duration).

Bone Densitometry (BMD) Whole Body Scan data file. The BMD data files include results from the DXA scans performed at the Clinical Centers participating in the WHI Osteoporosis substudy. Participants with valid results from a whole body scan are included in the data files. These data have been analyzed and monitored by the UCSF DXA Quality Assurance Center before being transferred to the CCC.
Outcomes - Calcium and Vitamin D (CaD) Trial Self-Reported data file
Outcomes - Clinical Trials (CT) + Observational Study (OS) Self-Reported data file

This subject consent data table includes subject IDs and consent group information for all WHI cohort study and substudy subjects. The data table also includes a mapping of subject IDs to other subject ID aliases.

Bone Densitometry (BMD) Spine Scan data file. The BMD data files include results from the DXA scans performed at the Clinical Centers participating in the WHI Osteoporosis substudy. Participants with valid results from a spine scan are included in the data files. These data have been analyzed and monitored by the UCSF DXA Quality Assurance Center before being transferred to the CCC.
Form 149 - Supplement to Observational Study (OS) Follow-Up Questionnaire (Year 9) -- care giving responsibilities; life events; breast cancer; use of weight loss medications; parents' birthplace.

Form 148 - Observational Study (OS) Follow-Up Questionnaire (Year 8) -- current weight; recent weight change; current physical activity and exercise (frequency, duration); current smoking status; use of weight loss medications; coffee, tea, soft drink consumption ; recent use SERMS, recent use of hormone replacement therapy; diagnoses of new medical conditions; family history of senile dementia; current marital status.
Form 44 - Current Medications -- medication use during Main WHI Study (1993-2005)

Form 147 - Observational Study (OS) Follow-Up Questionnaire (Year 7) -- current weight; recent weight change; current physical activity and exercise (frequency, duration); use of weight loss medications; recent use of hormone replacement therapy; diagnoses of new medical conditions; family history of breast cancer; life events; parents' birthplace; current marital status.

Blood Results: Clinic Complete Blood Count (CBC) Results data file. The CBC data file includes the results from serum collected at a baseline visit and analyzed at each CC's local laboratory. All clinical trial and observational study participants were to have serum collected. Data is missing if the lab was unable to process the sample. Values were reported for the following tests: white blood cell count (Kcell/ml), platelet count (Kcell/ml), hematocrit (%) and hemoglobin (gm/dl).
Outcomes - Deep Vein Thrombosis/Pulmonary Embolism (Form 126)

Blood Results: Core Analyte Results data file. The Core analytes data file contains results from two sources. The first source is a subsample of CT participants selected at random for blood specimen analysis that includes approximately 8.6% of the HRT and 4.3% of the DM participants. Their baseline, and annual visits 1, 3, and 9 blood specimens were analyzed. The second source is a very small sample of OS whose blood was collected at baseline and within 6 months after baseline. Computed values include Alpha-Carotene, Alpha-Tocopherol, Beta-Carotene, Beta-Cryptoxanthine, Factor VII Antigen, Factor VII, Fibrinogen, Glucose, Gamma-Tocopherol, High-Density Lipoprotein-2, High-Density Lipoprotein-3, HDL Cholesterol, Insulin, LDL Cholesterol, Apolipoprotein(a), Lycopene, Lutein and Zeaxanthin, Retinol, Total Cholesterol, Triglyceride.
Electrocardiogram (ECG) - Myocardial Infarction (MI) Novacode Follow-Up Results data file.

Form 143 - Observational Study (OS) Follow-Up Questionnaire (Year 3) -- recent weight change, figure (weight) identification; current physical activity and exercise (frequency, duration); usual activities; past strenuous physical activity by age (frequency); recent alcohol consumption, change in alcohol consumption habits; recent coffee/tea/water/diet drinks consumption; recent use of fats or oils; current smoking, current smoking exposure; current employment status, current marital status, partner's current employment status; total family income; existence and recent use of usual medical care provider, change in usual medical provider; choice options in current health insurance coverage, type(s) of current health insurance coverage and payment mechanism; recent use of hormone replacement therapy; diagnoses of new medical conditions.

Form 145 - Observational Study (OS) Follow-Up Questionnaire (Year 5) -- current weight, recent weight change; current physical activity and exercise (frequency, duration); current smoking; video, video display terminal exposure; depression scale; frequency religious practices; recent use of alternative medical treatments; current dental health, frequency of professional dental care; recent use of hormone replacement therapy; diagnoses of new medical conditions; current marital status.

Form 146 - Observational Study (OS) Follow-Up Questionnaire (Year 6) -- current weight, recent weight change; current physical activity and exercise (frequency, duration); usual activities; coffee, tea, soft drink, alcohol consumption; current smoking; smoking exposure; existence and recent use of medical care provider, status and types of health insurance; use of natural hormones; use of osteoporosis prescription medications; recent use of hormone replacement therapy; diagnoses of new medical conditions; family history of Alzheimer's; current employment status; current marital status; family finances.

WHI Extension Membership -- includes subjects who are enrolled in the WHI Extension, days since main study randomization or enrollment to WHI Extension, and years in WHI since the start of WHI Extension.

Form 150 - Hormone Use Update WHI Extension -- in the past year, medications used to treat or prevent osteoporosis, female hormones used or were prescribed, such as estrogen, progesterone, and/or testosterone in the form of pills, patches, shots, creams, etc, and the frequency of their use.

Form 151 - Activities of Daily Life -- current experiences, i.e., general health and quality of life, subject's typical day's activies and if health limits those activities, and ability to perform routine activities.
Outcomes - Stroke/Carotid Artery Disease (Form 121/132)

Form 42 - Observational Study (OS) Questionnaire -- birth weight, birth status, breast feeding at birth; coffee/tea consumption; alcohol history; smoking history; history of breast examination, history of benign breast disease, recent history of mammogram; history of the use of powders in genital area or on sanitary napkins; history of diaphragm; history electric blanket use; religious affiliation; recent history of physical activity and exercise (frequency, duration); occupational history; height and weight history, weight change; state of residence history. This self-administered questionnaire was required for all OS participants.

Outcomes - Fracture (Form 123)

Form 84 - Clinical Breast Exam - nipple discharge; skin, axillary, or breast mass; mass size, mobility, number; follow-up results. This form was not required for OS participants, but was included for OS if available.

The subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of subject IDs to sample IDs. Included are samples from WHI SHARe, GO-ESP, GARNET, CARe, PAGE, Imputation, WHIMS+, and BA23 CHD. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample aliases and the substudy (phs accession) that the sample belongs to.

Form 20 - Personal Information -- education; employment status; occupation; marital status; partner's education, employment status, occupation; total family income; recent history of mammogram, pelvic exam, endometrial aspiration; insurance coverage; serve in armed services. Case Control Enriched Phenotypes (WES) year 1: prevalent and incident AD status, AD diagnosis, selection criteria, age (n=2 variables; baseline, onset or last exam), APOE genotype, availability of autopsy data, Braak stage, and general sociodemographic (race and ethnicity) of participants for whom whole exome sequencing (WXS) data are available.

Family Subject Phenotypes (WGS) year 1: AD affection status, Braak stage, presence of APOE allele combinations, availability of autopsy material, and general sociodemographic (race and ethnicity) data of participants for whom whole genome sequencing (WGS) data are available.

Case Control Enriched Phenotypes (WES) year 0: prevalent and incident AD status, AD diagnosis, selection criteria, age (n=2 variables; baseline, onset or last exam), APOE genotype, availability of autopsy data, Braak stage, and general sociodemographic (race and ethnicity) of participants for whom whole exome sequencing (WXS) data are available.
The subject consent data table includes subject IDs, consent information, and subject aliases.

Connecting Family Subject Phenotypes year 1: participants' family members' AD affection status, Braak stage, APOE allele presence, availability of autopsy material, and general sociodemographic data (race and ethnicity).
This sample attributes table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, tumor status, and sequencing center.
This pedigree data table contains family relationships in the format of family IDs, subject IDs, father IDs, mother IDs, subjects's sex, and family group ethnicity.
Demographics (Short): gender, ethnicity, and race.
Age at Onset: age in which disease (walking, speech, vision, hand problems) symptoms occurred first, spinocerebellar ataxias (SCA) age, and other symptoms.
Timed Tests: quantitative tests of motor function (9-hole Peg Test (9HPT) and Timed 25-foot Walk (T25FW)).
Eligibility: inclusion/exclusion criteria for spinocerebellar ataxias (SCA), diagnosis (type of SCA and DNA testing).
This sample attributes table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, tumor status, sequencing center, funding source, TOPMed phase, project, and study name.
Health Questionnaire (EQ-5D): mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression.
This subject consent file includes subject IDs and consent group information.
Conclusion of Study Participants: participant's completion status, form status and name, participant cycle number and visit, withdrawal status, and reasons for withdrawal.
Patient Global Impression: impression since last visit or in the last 6 months (disease status, walking, hand function, and speech).
Physician Global Impression: global disease impression according to physician.
Registration: RDCRN Protocol number, participant status, age in years at registration and start of study.
General Physical Exam: vital signs, anthropometry, general assessments using the Tanner scale, and findings by region.
General Medical History: allergies, past illnesses/conditions, and hospitalizations.

SARA: Scale for the assessment and rating of ataxia (SARA). The assessments are related to gait, stance, sitting, speech, finger-chase test, nose-finger test, fast alternating movements and heel-shin test.
UHDRS-IV: Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale part IV
PHQ9: depressive symptoms, anxiety, and their effect on everyday life.

Neurological Examination: ophthalmological findings, other cranial nerve findings, muscle atrophy, fasciculations, paresis, spacticity, chorea/dyskinesia, dystonia, tremor, vibration loss, reflexes, extensor plantar reflex, other dysfunction, myoclonus, and rigidity.
Concomitant Medications: status of medications taken currently (name, dose, units, frequency, interval, route, indication, start and stop dates).
Death Record: manner of death, autopsy, surgery, and cause of death.
Functional Staging: a scale ranging from 0 to 6.0 evaluating the changes in functional performance and activities of daily living skills.
Therapy Review: physical therapy, speech therapy, occupational therapy, psychotherapy, inpatient rehab, and hospitalization.

This sample attributes table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, histological type, and tumor status for Whole Exome Sequencing of Tourette Syndrome Parent and Proband study.

This data table contains MRI scanner field strength information, and Freesurfer 5.2 Desikan-Killiany Atlas Cortical Parcellation Surface Area for different left hemisphere brain areas (n=35 variables).
Subject ID, age, sex, race, and BMI of participants involved in the "Common Variation in Candidate Genes in the Diabetes Prevention Program" project.
This subject phenotype table includes sex, race, ethnicity, and sample IDs for a Follow-up Genome-wide Association Study of Tourette Syndrome.
Subject ID, sample ID, and sample use variable obtained from participants involved in the "Common Variation in Candidate Genes in the Diabetes Prevention Program" project.
This data table contains FDG PET (fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography) mean volume measurements for different brain regions (n=738 variables).
This sample attributes table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, histological type, and tumor status for the Genome-wide Association Study of Tourette Syndrome.
This data table provides image metadata (scan-id, type of scan performed [T1, T2, DWI, etc.], voxel resolution, etc.).
The subject consent data table contains subject IDs, consent group information, subject aliases, and affection status for Tourette Syndrome (TS).
This pedigree data table contains family relationships in the format of family IDs, subject IDs, father IDs, mother IDs, and sex of subjects.
This subject phenotype table includes sex, race, ethnicity, and sample IDs for the Genome-wide Association Study of Tourette Syndrome.
Subject ID and consent group of participants involved in the "Common Variation in Candidate Genes in the Diabetes Prevention Program" project.
This data table contains imaging data calculating brain volumes for different brain regions, and white matter and gray matter volume calculations for different brain reqions (n=21 variables).
This data table contains answers to the WHO Disability Assessment Schedule, as reported by a companion.

This data table contains region of Interest data: scalar diffusion and volume data of cortical, subcortical (including amygdala, basal ganglia, corpus callosum, thalamus), brain stem structures are measured (n=553 variables).
This data table contains SBM loading coefficients for various components using source based morphometry via structural MRI to identify gray matter differences over time (n=46 variables).

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs.

This subject phenotype table includes sex, race, ethnicity, and sample IDs for Whole Exome Sequencing of Tourette Syndrome Parent and Proband study.

This data table contains information about the CAG extension length, laboratory determined or self-reported, and general socio-demographic data (n=5 variables; gender, race, ethnicity, age, years of education).
This subject consent data table contains subject IDs,  affection status, and consent group information.

This data table contains MRI scanner field strength information, and Freesurfer 5.2 Desikan-Killiany Atlas Cortical Parcellation Surface Area for different right hemisphere brain areas (n=35 variables).
This data table contains summary data of cognitive function measurements as described by the Stroop (Color, Digit, Word) and Symbol Digit Modalities Tests (SDMT).

This data table contains biomarkers tested and concentrations detected in study participants: e.g. 8-hydroxy-2'-deoxyguanosine, 3-hydroxykynurenine, 4-hydroxyphenyllactate, homovanillic acid, tryptophan, serotonin, uric acid, xanthine, etc.

This data table contains psychiatric assessment scores obtained through FRSBE (Frontal Systems Behavior Scale), questions 1-18, as reported by participant; SCL90 (Global Severity Index, Positive Symptom Total and Distress Index), as reported by participant; and UHDRS (Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale), questions 25 - 35, as reported by the participant.

The data table reports the existence, start and cessation times of comorbid conditions encountered with study participants (e.g. allergies, arthrosis, asthma, cancer, epilepsy, GERD, myalgia, psoriasis, type 2 diabetes, etc.).

This data table contains information about the functional capacity of participants, as informed by participants, determined through UHDRS (Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale) questions 70 - 74.
This data table contains MRI scanner field strength information, and Freesurfer 5.2 brain volume measurements of different brain regions (n=63 variables).

The data table contains information about the motor functionality of participants as assessed through UHDRS (Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale) questions 1 - 15, diagnostic confidence level from question 17 of the UHDRS, and an estimation of future onset of motor symptoms.

This data table contains use of concomitant medications used by study participants, including acetaminophen, Albuterol, Atorvastatin, Citalopram, fish oil, gingko biloba, levothyroxine, supplements (vitamins B, C, D, E. multivitamins, calcium, zinc), sertraline, venlafaxine, verapamil, etc..
This data table contains MRI scanner field strength information, and Freesurfer 5.2 White Matter Parcellation Volumes for different left and right hemisphere brain regions (n=75 variables).

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. OrderedProcedures: Study specified patient procedures that have been ordered. A fixed set of CPT and ICD9/10 procedures codes as well as common names for the procedures were provided to the participating healthcare systems, healthcare systems queried the medical records of their participants by either manual chart review of programmatic querying of the medical record.

CompletedProcedures: Study specified patient procedures that have been completed. A fixed set of CPT and ICD9/10 procedures codes were provided to the participating healthcare systems, healthcare systems queried the medical records of their participants, typically using billing records.
FamilyHistory: Self reported medical history for the participant and their relatives, collected by MeTree.
The subject consent data table contains subject IDs and consent group information.
Diagnoses: Participant diagnoses for study specified ICD9 diagnosis codes pulled from the study participant's medical record. ICD9 codes were mapped to ICD10s based on the CMS supplied cross-walk.
EMRlength: The windows for which the participant's medical records were queried pre- and post-intervention.

3MonthPost: 3 month follow-up participant survey including validated instruments, medication adherence, readiness to change, patient activation, quality of life, diet, activity, tobacco and alcohol use, and internally developed instruments to assess past cancer screening, satisfaction with MeTree, and experience with MeTree.

12MonthPost: 12 month follow-up participant survey including validated instruments, medication adherence, readiness to change, patient activation, quality of life, diet, activity, tobacco and alcohol use and internally developed instruments to assess past cancer screening and actions since using MeTree.
Referrals: Study relevant referrals, such as specialist referrals, found in the participant's medical record. Data generated by either programmatic querying of the medical record or chart review.
Visits: Participant clinic visits, found in the participant's medical record. Data generated by either programmatic querying of the medical record or chart review.

GeneticTestingCounselingOutcomes: Result of the MeTree clinical decisions algorithm for whether or not a participant meets guideline criteria for genetic counseling or genetic testing. Chart review was completed for the participants that have a genetic testing or genetic counseling recommendation to assess whether or not that participant had an order and/or attended a genetic counseling appointment.

GeneticTestingResults: Among participants who had a genetic testing or genetic counseling recommendation, what study relevant genetic testing and the results of that genetic testing has been completed. Data generated by manual chart review of specified participant's medical record.
PersonalHistory: Self reported personal medical history collected by MeTree.
LabResults: Study relevant labs found in the participants medical record. Data generated by either programmatic querying of the medical record or chart review.

Baseline: Baseline participant survey including validated instruments, health literacy, medication adherence, readiness to change, patient activation, quality of life, diet, activity, tobacco and alcohol use and internally developed instruments to assess past cancer screening and information seeking.
Medications: Medical record based presence of study relevant medications. Data generated by either programmatic querying of the medical record or chart review.
Vitals: Participant's vital measurements found in the participant's medical record. Data generated by either programmatic querying of the medical record or chart review.

This data table contains a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample aliases.

Data contain medical history information of participating subjects (and family occurrence of myocardial infarcts/stroke [n=4 variables]), describing their general physical and psychological health (all > 65 years of age), results of blood work, use of medications/multivitamins, and subjects' cognitive and emotional well being. The dataset provides results of overnight (at home) polysomnography (PSG) that included e.g. oximetry, heart rate, EEG, EOG, EMG, airflow measurements; night-sleep data describe quality and length of sleep, sleep events such as  apnea (central/obstructive/hypopnea), arousal,  time spent in sleep stages, the respiratory disturbance index (RDI; overall, supine, non-supine, REM/non-REM, etc.), SaO2 measurements (min/max/average), etc. Day-time behavior, health status and medical history information is provided through variables querying for tiredness, naps taken (including narcolepsy events), energy level, emotional status, stress experience, lifestyle patterns describing dietary and smoking habits (alcohol, coffee, cigarette use), medical diagnoses received (e.g. angina, diabetes, heart attack, stroke), medications taken, and the results of questionnaires (including the SF36, Short Form [36] Health Survey, the standardized physical and mental component scales). Data also inform about quality checks of various measurements (n=56 variables), language in which interviews were conducted, etc., however the majority of the n=1271 variables report data of measurement/questionnaires taken.

Data contain extensive medical history information, describing general physical and psychological health of participating subjects (all > 65 years of age). Emphasis is given to auditory, visual, respiratory, cardio-vascular functions, medications/supplements taken, cognitive and emotional well being and subjects' mobility/independence and movement limitations. Lifestyle information is provided through variables querying for alcohol consumption, dietary, exercise and smoking habits. Data were collected at year 11.

The dataset includes results of overnight (at home) polysomnography (PSG) that included e.g. oximetry, heart rate, EEG, EOG, EMG, airflow measurements; night-sleep data describe quality and length of sleep, sleep events such as  apnea (central/obstructive/hypopnea), arousal,  time spent in sleep stages, the respiratory disturbance index (RDI; overall, supine, non-supine, REM/non-REM, etc.), SaO2 measurements (min/max/average), etc. Day-time behavior, health status and medical history information is provided through variables querying for tiredness, naps taken, energy level, emotional status, stress experience, lifestyle patterns describing dietary and smoking habits (alcohol, coffee, cigarette use), medical diagnoses received (e.g. angina, diabetes, heart attack, stroke), medications taken, and the results of questionnaires (including the SF36, Short Form [36] Health Survey, the standardized physical and standardized mental component scales). While a few variables report on the quality/quantity of available data (e.g. hours of usable recordings available, equipment calibrations performed), form/center IDs,  education obtained,  gender, language in which interviews were conducted, etc., the majority of the n=1411 variables report measurement/questionnaire data.

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs, including sample repository  source and sample aliases. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs.

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample source.
This subject consent data table contains subject IDs, consent group information, and subject source.
This sample attributes data table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, and sequencing center.
This subject phenotype data table includes subject sex, age, race, education, colorectal cancer diagnosis and age, and intestinal polyps diagnosis and age.

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. This sample attributes data table contains cell type and analyte type.

This sample attributes data table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, and tumor status for samples linked to PMID: 25735005 WGS 98 Hutterites (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25735005).

This sample attributes data table includes sample treatment type, batch of RNA extraction, sequencing pool, histological type, analyte type, body site where sample was collected, and tumor status. This dataset is linked to PMID: 29977032 FcgammaRIIA variant effects (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/29977032).

This sample attributes data table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, histological type, and tumor status for samples linked to PMID: 21212097 (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21212097) Exome sequencing of a large family with autosomal recessive non-syndromic mental retardation (NSMR) revealed a novel mutation in the TECR gene on chromosome 19p13. These samples also link to PMID: 22981120 (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22981120) 3 autosomal-recessive (AR) disease-causing mutations were identified in the Hutterites. Carrier frequencies and carrier burdens for 14 mutations associated with 13 AR diseases were determined using exome sequencing, targeted Sanger sequencing, and direct genotyping.

This sample attributes data table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, and tumor status for samples linked to PMID: 23001126 WGS 16 Hutterites (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23001126).

This sample attributes data table includes season of sample collection, technical replicates, version of CASAVA used for base calling, antibiotics status prior to sampling, body site where sample was collected, analyte type, and tumor status for samples linked to PMID: 24618913 Fecal Microbiome (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24618913).
This subject phenotype data table provides affection status (asthma/not) and sex of individuals linked to PMID: 23001126 WGS 16 Hutterites (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23001126).

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. The subject consent data table contains Hutterites subject IDs and consent group information.
This subject phenotype data table includes age and sex of individuals linked to PMID: 28143570 Nasal Microbiome (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28143570).

This sample attributes data table includes date of collection, final DNA concentration prior to 16S PCR, DNA fragment size prior to sequencing, body site and season where sample was collected, and name of fastQ file linked to PMID: 28143570 Nasal Microbiome (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28143570).

This subject phenotype data table includes age, sex of individuals, rs1801274 genotypes and counts of A alleles. This dataset is linked to PMID: 29977032 FcgammaRIIA variant effects (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/29977032).
This response eQTLs sample attributes data table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, tumor status, histological type, and concentration of doxorubicin added to cells.

This sample attributes data table includes body site where sample was collected, analyte type, histological type, and tumor status for samples linked to PMID: TBD Family Based WGS (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/TBD) A comparison of whole genome sequences from 3-generation pedigrees of humans and baboons suggested that germline mutation rates do not track cell divisions.
This data table includes age, sex of individuals, BMI, and BMI residuals linked to PMID: 24618913 Fecal Microbiome (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24618913).

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs, both of which are T1DGC Analytic IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample source and substudy (phs) accession that the sample belongs to.

This subject phenotypes data table includes affection status, self-reported sex and race, birthplace, age at enrollment, and age of disease onset.

This sample attributes data table informs of the body site where sample was collected, sample analyte type, sample cell or tissue type, whether the sample is a tumor, and gestational age when sample was collected.

This data table contains mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs.

This sample attributes table includes the body site where sample was collected, analyte type, tumor status, histological type, primary tumor location, tumor stage, metastasis or transformed cell line information, genotyping center, and sequencing center.

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. The data table also includes sample source and sample use.
This sample attributes table contains sample IDs, body site where sample was collected, analyte type, and name of the center which conducted genotyping.
The subject consent file includes subject IDs, consent information, subject aliases, and case control status of the subject for biliary atresia.
