This subject phenotype table contains subject IDs, affection status of the subject for pediatric cancer and blood disorder, sex, race, age, and age onset.

This sample attributes table contains sample IDs, body site, analyte type, tumor status, histological type, preservation method, primary tumor location, tumor stage, tumor grade, and name of the centers which conducted genotyping or sequencing.

This data table contains stroke adjudication information and includes statuses for the following procedures and symptoms/effects: angioplasty, thrombolytics, neurological symptoms, visual effects, chronic infarction, CT scans (acute ischemic area, intraparenchymal bleeding, subarachnoid bleeding), MRI (chronic infarction, acute ischemic area, intraparenchymal bleeding, subarachnoid bleeding), underlying cause, and whether stroke was a primary cause of death.

This data table contains information about death certificates received and includes ICD-9 Cause of Death Code, ICD-9 Code for the first, second, and third underlying causes of death, place of death, and manner of death.

This data table contains information about screening subject for inclusion/exclusion criteria and includes whether subject is aged 55-80, meets age-related macular degeneration (AMD) requirements, received pupillary dilation, will take study product, willing to stop taking other supplements, has a disease in either eye that would confound retinal assessment, previous retinal or other surgeries that might complicate assessment of AMD progression, chronic requirement for systemic or ocular medication known to be toxic to the retina/optic nerve, supplemented with 2 mg or more of lutein and/or 500 mg or more of DHA/EPA or fish oil for period of one year or more prior to date of randomization, intraocular pressure is more than 26 mm Hg or indication of glaucoma, cataract surgery within the last three months or capsulotomy within the last six weeks, lung cancer history, systemic disease with poor prognosis, status for hemochromatosis/Wilson's Disease/oxalate kidney stones, enrolled in another study that could affect adherence, taking a systemic anti-angiogenic for treatment for choroidal neovascularization or cancer, eligible for the Run-in AREDS-type supplements (ATS).
This data table contains reporting of serious adverse event information and includes date, age at event, and weight.
This data table contains Harvard Dietary Assessment information and includes whether assessment was obtained and assessment delivery format (self-administered or interviewed by clinical staff).

This data table contains information from a cognitive telephone interview and includes responses from the Hearing Handicap Inventory for the Elderly (HHEI), the Wechsler Memory Scale (WECOK), CES-D Scale (DEPOK), Telephone Interview of Cognitive Status (TICS), and data from Letter Fluency tasks.

This table contains information about study closeout data including subject's lifestyle and environment including smoking status and exposure, medication use (blood modifying, gastrointestinal, heart, sleep and anxiety, and neuromuscular), visual acuity, diet, Charles Bonnet syndrome status, and location of grandparents' birth.

This data table contains fundus autofluorescence (AF) left eye imaging annotations and includes statuses for superonasal, superotemporal, inferotemporal, and inferonasal statuses for zones 1 and 2, and superior and inferior statuses for zone 3 (N=124 variables; neovascular AMD presence, increased pigment, decreased pigment, GA presence, drusen presence, maximum drusen size, reticular drusen presence, abnormal AF presence, hypo AF, halo presence, hyper AF, reticular pattern presence); and overall color AF grading status.

This data table contains sudden death/resuscitated death adjudication information and includes whether subject lost consciousness and whether it lasted at least 30 seconds, pulse or respiration status, whether an ECG or a cardiac rhythm strip was obtained and available for review, rhythm description (ventricular fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia, asystole, severe bradycardia, pulseless electrical activity, other), interventions (CPR, defibrillation), and outcome (death, resuscitated cardiac arrest date, whether there was a definite or probably resuscitated cardiac death, whether met sudden death criteria, whether death was due to definite coronary heart disease).

This data table contains death report information and includes primary cause of death, location of death, whether death was related to study supplement, whether the death certificate was received, whether there was a report of a new adverse event since last study contact, and whether the subject was hospitalized since the last visit.

This data table contains data from the Cognitive Telephone Interview (shortened) and includes responses from the Hearing Handicap Inventory for the Elderly (HHEI), CES-D Scale (DEPOK), and Telephone Interview of Cognitive Status (TICS).

This data table contains heart failure adjudication information and includes whether subject had symptoms of heart failure, whether chest X-rays were obtained and results, whether B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP) levels were obtained (NT-pro_BNP, Reg BNP, BNP value, and whether at the upper limit of normal for the hospital), whether assessment of ventricular function was obtained (with left ventricular value and ventricular function assessment, diastolic function assessment), was subject treated with medications consistent with heart failure, whether hospitalized for heart failure, whether died within 30 days of acute hospitalization, whether heart failure was primary cause of death, and date adjudication considered final).

This data table contains study status information and includes whether subject completed study visits, reason for discontinuing study, whether subject was approached for closeout, and whether subject agreed to a closeout visit.
This data table contains Genetics Study informed consent information.

This data table contains information about enrolling subject into randomization and includes whether fundus photograph retakes were required for either eye, Run-In adherence information (for lutein/zeaxanthin and EPA/DHA), Run-in adherence percent (ineligible for study if less than 75%), willingness to stop taking supplements containing nutrients under the study, whether Reading Center assessed fundus photography of adequate quality, whether still eligible for AREDS2, status of advanced age-related macular degeneration, whether taking AREDS-type supplement before the qualification period, willingness to be randomized to one of the forms of the AREDS-type supplements, willingness and eligibility to take the "regular" form of the AREDS-type supplement (eligible if has not smoked within past year), whether agreed to participate in Nutritional Biochemistry Study in selected clinics, whether agreed to be contacted about the Cognitive Function Study, whether currently taking a multivitamin, and if wanted to take Centrum Silver.
This data table contains information about subject enrollment into Advantage EDC (Electronic Data Capture) System and includes medication protocol assignments.

This data table contains current medication information and includes information about medications taken to treat various conditions (angina, heart attack), and specific beta blocker medications (N=59 variables), angiotensin II converting enzyme inhibitors (N=60 variables), angiotensin receptor blockers (N=32 variables), anti-platelet medication (N=11 variables).

This data table contains medical and family history and includes information about high blood pressure history (whether ever notified about by a medical professional, whether notified two or more times, taking medication), congestive heart failure (whether notified about by a medical professional, taking medication), coronary heart disease (whether notified about by a medical professional, taking medication), angina (whether notified about by a medical professional, taking medication for angina or chest pain), myocardial infarction (whether notified about by a medical professional, taking medication), stroke (whether notified about by a medical professional, taking medication), high cholesterol (whether notified about by a medical professional, taking medication), patient assessment of general health, relatives with macular degeneration, relatives with cataracts or cataract surgery, heart attack history of relatives and ages before or after 50, whether parents are deceased and age at death.
This data table contains subject demographic information and includes age at randomization, gender, race, ethnicity, marital status, and highest level of school.

This data table contains vitamin usage data and includes the following medications with dosage information (N=39 variables; AREDS-type, multivitamin, Preservision, Vitamin A, beta-carotene, vitamin C, vitamin E, zinc, lutein/zeaxanthin, lutein, zeaxanthin, DHA, fish oil).

This data table contains annual in-clinic visit information about both eyes and includes method of administration of dilated fundus exams, and statuses for: geographic atrophy, pigment abnormalities, treatment for age-related macular degeneration (AMD), drusen treatment, neovascularization or its consequences, AMD non-specific consequences, unknown treatments, laser photocoagulation, photodynamic therapy, anti-angiogenic therapy, anti-angiogenic medications and dosages, other FDA-approved therapy, other therapy, cataract surgery since last visit, Yag capsulotomy since last visit, refraction data, visual acuity scores, smoking status, diabetes history, adverse experience since last visit (and whether treatment was at hospital, or as outpatient), new lung diagnosis, supplement use (N=13 variables; new supplement, DHA, omega-3, cod liver oil, zeaxanthin, EPA, fish oil vitamin C, vitamin E, beta-carotene, zinc, copper), and Snellen visual acuity measurements.
This data table contains information about timing of patient re-randomization and reason for re-randomization, and new AREDS type supplement (ATS) assignment.

This data table contains image lens grading data from the Reading Center and includes statuses for red reflex, iris pigmentation, iris neovascularization, lens status, lens opacities, cortical opacities, posterior subcapsular cataract (PSC), vacuoles, white anterior cortical opacities (WACOS), pseudo exfoliation, Mittendorf's dot, and other opacities.

This data table contains fundus autofluorescence (AF) right eye imaging annotations and includes statuses for superonasal, superotemporal, inferotemporal, and inferonasal statuses for zones 1 and 2, and superior and inferior statuses for zone 3 (N=124 variables; neovascular AMD presence, increased pigment, decreased pigment, GA presence, drusen presence, maximum drusen size, reticular drusen presence, abnormal AF presence, hypo AF, halo presence, hyper AF, reticular pattern presence); and overall color AF grading status.

This data table contains a review of adverse events experienced by subject, including timing, outcome (determined to be serious, expedited or reportable), whether event is potentially related to study supplements, reporting requirements (whether DSMC, MedWatch, or expedited report required), whether event was expected or anticipated, and review status.

This data table contains information about adverse events experienced by subject including type, existence prior to study enrollment, severity (life threating, medically significant), outcome (n= 5 variables; death, hospitalization, prolonged hospitalization, disability/capacity, resolution status), congenital or anatomical defect information, and information about timing of events.
This subject consent data table contains subject IDs, consent group information, and subject aliases.

This data table contains eye fundus grading information from the Reading Center (AMD Color version 1.0) and includes status for neovascular AMD, statuses for serous of fibrovascular pigment epithelial detachment (PED) presence and area measurements, serous retinal detachment and measurements, hard exudate characteristic of AMD, hemorrhage characteristic of AMD, laser photocoagulation treatment for neovascular AMD, subretinal fibrosis and area measurements, visible choroidal new vessels, pigment abnormalities, geographic atrophy, soft drusen, calcified drusen, reticular drusen, confounding and other abnormalities, and AREDS AMD calculated severity scale and level. For AMD Color 1.0 grading of fundus photos, two graders were used per visit; this was used for all qualification visits and some year 1 visits.

This data table contains outpatient procedure information and includes the following procedures: cardiac catheterization, cardiac angioplasty/stent (PTCIOPP), implantable cardioverter defibrillator, carotid artery angioplasty/stent/endarterectomy (CAANGIO), peripheral artery angioplasty, and whether there was an irregular heartbeat.

This data table contains information about cardiac events including timing, physical indicators of cardiac stress (chest pain involvement, stress testing and results, and ECG testing and results), blood serum indicators of cardiac stress (cardiac enzymes, troponin, creatine kinase myocardial band test, total creatinine kinase), physical interventions (cardiac catheterization, percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty [PTCI], coronary artery bypass graft surgery [CABG], and implantable cardioverter defibrillator [ICD]), event adjudication (timing, final, whether processed 24 hours after procedure, 30 days after CABG, or 30 days after surgery), timing of death and whether myocardial infarction/cardiac is determined to be the primary cause of death.
This data table contains information about nutritional biochemistry study data including blood serum levels of supplements, and timing of sample collection.

This data table contains information about eye treatments (cataract surgery and timing, Yag capsulotomy, treatment for age-related macular degeneration since last visit (drusen, geographic atrophy, corneal neovascularization, photodynamic therapy, anti-angiogenic therapy, medications, and dosages, or other therapies), and changes since last visit (new supplement, lutein, DHA, omega oil, cod oil, EPA, zeaxanthin, fish oil, vitamin C, vitamin E, beta-carotene, zinc, or copper).

This data table contains information about protocol anomalies, including timing, photographs not obtained, blood draw not obtained, whether subject stopped taking supplements, intolerance to supplements (EPA/DHA, lutein/zeaxanthin, or AREDS type supplements [ATS]), supplement noncompliance (EPA/DHA, lutein/zeaxanthin, or ATS), supplements lost/stolen/thrown away, wrong bottle code, additional non-study supplements (nutrients, lutein/zeaxanthin, vitamin E, vitamin C, vitamin A, zinc, omega-3, fish oil, cod oil), and whether there were other protocol anomalies.

This data table contains eye fundus grading information from the Reading Center (AMD Color version 2.0) and includes status for neovascular AMD, statuses for serous of fibrovascular pigment epithelial detachment (PED) presence and area measurements, serous retinal detachment and measurements, hard exudate characteristic of AMD, hemorrhage characteristic of AMD, laser photocoagulation treatment for neovascular AMD, subretinal fibrosis and area measurements, visible choroidal new vessels, pigment abnormalities, geographic atrophy, soft drusen, calcified drusen, reticular drusen, confounding and other abnormalities, and AREDS AMD calculated severity scale and level. For AMD Color 2.0 grading of fundus photos, a single grader was used per visit; this was used for most year 1 visits and all visits after year 1.

This data table contains a cardiovascular outcomes study report and includes information about date of hospitalization, procedure, or death, type of event (cardio/cerebrovascular, myocardial infarction, irregular heartbeat, stroke/transient ischemic attack, resuscitated cardiac arrest, congestive heart failure, death, chest pain, other event), procedure (cardiovascular, cardiac catherization, carotid artery stent, coronary artery bypass, placement of implantable cardioverter defibrillator, cardiac angioplasty/stent, other procedure).

This data table contains hospitalization information and includes primary reason for hospitalization, events or procedures during hospitalization (heart attack or MI, coronary bypass, cardiac catheterization, balloon angioplasty, cardiac angioplasty/stent [PTCIHSP], cardioverter defibrillator placement, chest pain, stroke/transient ischemic attack, carotid artery angioplasty/stent/endarterectomy, peripheral artery angioplasty, congestive heart failure, resuscitated cardiac arrest, irregular heartbeat, and/or loss of consciousness).

This data table contains information about nutritional biochemistry including whether visit is for screening or post-randomization, visit number, timing of blood draw, timing of last food and drink, type of foods eaten, alcohol consumption, and whether subject smoked in the 24 hours prior.
The subject consent file includes subject IDs, subject source, consent information, and case control status of the subject for Moyamoya Disease.
This sample attributes table contains sample IDs, body site where sample was collected, and analyte type.
This subject phenotype table contains subject IDs, age, ethnicity, gender, height, and blood type.

This data table contains a mapping of study subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. For example, if one patient (subject ID) gave one sample, and that sample was processed differently to generate 2 sequencing runs, there would be two rows, both using the same subject ID, but having 2 unique sample IDs. The data table also includes sample source.
This subject phenotype data table includes the subject's sex, decade and year of birth, ethnicity, and race.
This subject phenotype data table includes subject's sex, decade and year of birth, race, ethnicity, and case control status of various phenotypes (n=40 variables).
The subject consent data table contains eMERGE subject IDs and consent group information.
This sample attributes table includes analyte type.
This pedigree data table contains family relationships in the format of family IDs, subject IDs, father IDs, mother IDs, sex of subjects, and monozygotic twin IDs.

This subject phenotype data table includes subject's status for various phenotypes: essential hypertension, type 2 diabetes, hyperlipidemia, coronary atherosclerosis, asthma, morbid obesity, atrial fibrillation, GERD, major depressive disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, Hypothyroidism NOS, allergic rhinitis, hypercholesterolemia, obesity, malignant neoplasm of female breast, depression, other mental disorder, obstructive sleep apnea, mixed hyperlipidemia, autism, and kidney replaced by transplant.

This subject sample mapping data table includes a mapping of eMERGE subject IDs to sample IDs. Samples are the final preps submitted for genotyping, sequencing, and/or expression data. Additionally, there are sample aliases indicating the institute that provided the sample.
This BMI subject phenotype data table includes subject's weight, height, body mass index, age of observation, and visit number.

This subject phenotypes data table includes participants who have completed questionnaires regarding medical history, medications, physical activity, diet, alcohol intake, and cigarette smoking. Objective measures of anthropometric, neuromuscular, vision, strength, and cognitive variables were obtained at a clinic visit. Skeletal assessments included DEXA of the total hip, femoral neck and lumbar spine, calcaneal ultrasound, and vertebral radiographs. Radiographic prevalent and incident vertebral (baseline to visit 3) fractures were assessed. Sleep characteristics were assessed in a subcohort with actigraphy and polysomnography. Radiographic hip osteoarthritis was measured using hip X-rays collected at the SOF baseline visit and a modified Croft summary grade for radiographic hip OA (RHOA) severity of 0 - 4  was assigned to each hip based on individual radiographic features. Both SOF and MrOS data contain harmonized variables with the prefix HA to allow sex differences to be evaluated.

FHS Clinic Lab Assays Processed on Site, Offspring Cohort Exam 8

Vascular Morphology Measurements from CT Lung Image (Round 2), Offspring, Generation 3, Omni 1, and Omni 2, 2008-2011. This dataset contains vasculature measurements of the whole lung from the second round CT scans with the primary goal of accessing coronary artery calcification.
Large Artery Tonometry, Offspring Exam 7 and Omni 1 Exam 2. This dataset replaces dataset and ton1_7s due to a minor change in wave form calibration.
Non-Invasive Vascular Tonometry, Generation 3 Cohort Exam 1. This dataset replaces dataset and ton3_1s due to a minor change in wave form calibration.
Large Artery Tonometry, Original Cohort Exam 26. This dataset replaces ton0_26s due to a minor change in wave form calibration.
Genetics of Bone Structural Geometry of the Hip, Offspring Cohort Exams 6, 7

Bone Mineral Density, Original Cohort Exams 20, 22 and 24. Framingham Osteoporosis Study: Bone mineral density measurements were collected for the femur neck and trochanter and spine L2 to L4. Heel ultrasound measurements were collected for Exam 24.
Menopause, Original Cohort, Exams 1 - 14. Data collected include cause of menopause, status of estrogen use and number of ovaries removed.

Menstrual History Questionnaire, Offspring Cohort 1996 - 2001. This questionnaire was administered to all female participants who attended the baseline Ex6/7 Osteoporosis study, which is a callback from Offspring Exam 6.

P wave (Electrocardiography) Duration, Original Cohort Exam 11 and Offspring Exam 1. The Framingham Heart Study P wave indices (PWI) and longitudinal outcomes study was designed as a long-term, prospective study. The study's primary purpose was to generate an initial data set of PWI in the Framingham Heart Study, and then to apply this dataset towards (1) determining reference values for Framingham Heart Study participants without cardiovascular disease; (2) determining the long-term associations between PWI and the outcomes of heart failure, atrial fibrillation and mortality; and (3) contributing towards a genome wide association study of PWI.
Terminal Restriction Fragment Length, Offspring Cohort Exam 6

Venous Thrombosis Review, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2. Cases of deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolus or both, were reviewed from 1975 through August 2014.

Frequently Used Cardiovascular Risk Factors (a.k.a. "Workthru"), Offspring, Exam 1 - Exam 9. This purpose of this dataset is to: 1) Abstract and rename frequently used variables across exams for ease of use; 2) Standardize units across exams; 3) Standardize calculated variables across exams; 4) Incorporate variable value corrections reported over several years.

A lookup list that enables linking of subject data between the National Sleep Research Resource (NSRR -- sleepdata.org) and the database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP -- http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap).
Hip Shape Modes (HSM) Derived from DXA Scan Using Active Shape Modeling, Original Cohort Exam 22 (mostly) and Offspring Cohort Exams 6, 7.

Structural Brain MRI (Method 3), Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, performed from 3/1999 to 12/2017. This dataset contains MRI measures for participants in any of the FHS cohorts using the FRAM3 methodology. Hippocampal volumes and other brain regions of interest were previously submitted as separate datasets and are now combined. Includes post mortem brain MRIs. This dataset replaces t_mrbrnm2_2013_a_0958s and t_mrbrhpv_2014_a_1111s.

Dietary Guidelines Adherence Index (DGAI) 2010, Generation 3 Exam 1. The DGAI was created to assess adherence to the key recommendations in the 2010 Dietary Guidelines for Americans (DGA). The Index consists of 14 components based on energy specific food recommendations and 11 healthy choice components based on nutrient recommendations from the DGA. These variables are calculated based on responses to the Willett FFQ given at Generation 3 Exam 1, as well as the energy needs as determined by age, sex, physical activity and BMI.

Dietary Guidelines Adherence Index (DGAI) 2010, Generation 3 Exam 2. The DGAI was created to assess adherence to the key recommendations in the 2010 Dietary Guidelines for Americans (DGA). The Index consists of 14 components based on energy specific food recommendations and 11 healthy choice components based on nutrient recommendations from the DGA. These variables are calculated based on responses to the Willett FFQ given at Generation 3 Exam 2, as well as the energy needs as determined by age, sex, physical activity and BMI.

Dietary Guidelines Adherence Index (DGAI) 2010, Offspring 3 Exam 5. The DGAI was created to assess adherence to the key recommendations in the 2010 Dietary Guidelines for Americans (DGA). The Index consists of 14 components based on energy specific food recommendations and 11 healthy choice components based on nutrient recommendations from the DGA. These variables are calculated based on responses to the Willett FFQ given at Offspring 3 Exam 5, as well as the energy needs as determined by age, sex, physical activity and BMI.

Dietary Guidelines Adherence Index (DGAI) 2010, Offspring 3 Exam 7. The DGAI was created to assess adherence to the key recommendations in the 2010 Dietary Guidelines for Americans (DGA). The Index consists of 14 components based on energy specific food recommendations and 11 healthy choice components based on nutrient recommendations from the DGA. These variables are calculated based on responses to the Willett FFQ given at Offspring 3 Exam 7, as well as the energy needs as determined by age, sex, physical activity and BMI.

Observed Performance: Hand Grip, Measured Walks, Chair Stands, Original, Offspring, and Omni 1 Cohorts through 2005. This data was collected during the administration of the neuropsychological battery. The battery was usually administered in conjunction with a brain MRI. This dataset replaces dataset obsperform_2005s.

SHARe IDs: all participant identifiers, consent group, sex, and cohort group. This table also includes the mapping of SHARe IDs to SABRe subject IDs and HapMap subjects whose samples were used as genotype controls.
SHARe pedigrees: all participants. The variables included, but are not limited to family, subject, father and mother identifiers, sex and designation of identical individuals in families.
Aldosterone - Lab Assay (Blood), Offspring Exam 6 and Omni 1 Exam 1. This dataset replaces dataset aldo1_6s.

Lumbar Aortic Calcification, Original Cohort Exams 9 - 11, 21 - 23. These data are derived from spine x-rays and recorded around Exams 10 and 22 in the original Framingham cohort subjects. X-rays were read in 1995 - 1997. Lumbar aortic calcification was scored on each x-ray. Some subjects had x-rays only at the earlier exam and some only at the later exam. Some subjects had x-rays at both exams. There is a record for each exam. No one has more than two x-rays (records). The data were double entered, compared and resolved if there were differences.
Non-invasive Vascular Brachial Test, Generation 3 Cohort Exam 1
Cardiac MRI Left Ventricular Hypertrophy, Offspring and Omni 1 Cohorts 2002 - 2006. This dataset replaces dataset cmrlvh1_2006s.
Heart Rate Variability, Offspring Cohort 1983 - 1987
Hemostatic Factors, Offspring Cohort Exam 5

IGF-1, IGF BP4, IGF BP5 and Parathyroid Hormone, Offspring Cohort Exam 6. Participants were the first 50 men and first 50 women from each of 2 age groups (60-70 and greater then 70 years old) who consented to participate. The aim of the study was to examine the role of two of the IGF-1 binding proteins that were felt to play an important regulatory role in bone; namely IGF BP4 and IGF BP5. IGF-1 was also measured and a subset of subjects also had intact PTH assayed. Please see the methods paper in the igf1_6s_protocol for more information.
Knee Osteoarthritis, Original Cohort Exam 18
Lab Data - Additional Exam 5 Lab, Offspring Cohort Exam 5. Other lab data can be found within the Main Exam datasets.
Lab Data - Additional Exam 6 Lab, Offspring Cohort Exam 6. Other lab data can be found within the Main Exam datasets.

Lab Assay: Fructosamine (Blood), Offspring Exam 7, Omni 1 Exam 2, Generation 3 Exam 1, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1, and Omni 2 Exam 1

Clinic Exam Data: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1. This clinic exam questionnaire dataset consists of MD medical history and physical exam, technician interview questions, self- administered questions, ECG, blood pressure and anthropomorphic measurements.

Clinic Exam: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, Omni 2, Exam 1. This clinic exam questionnaire dataset consists of MD medical history and physical exam, technician interview questions, self- administered questions, ECG, blood pressure and anthropomorphic measurements.

Clinic Exam Data: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, Original Cohort Exam 31. Surviving original cohort participants were invited to participate in the 31st follow-up examination. The examination included a physician-administered medical history interview (or for examinations that occurred outside the research clinic, a technician-administered interview), technician-administered questionnaires to assess cognitive and physical function, and clinical measurements (anthropometrics, ECG and physical performance measures).

Clinic Exam Data: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, Original Cohort Exam 32. Surviving original cohort participants were invited to participate in the 32nd follow-up examination. The examination included a physician-administered medical history interview (or for examinations that occurred outside the research clinic, a technician-administered interview), technician-administered questionnaires to assess cognitive and physical function, and clinical measurements (anthropometrics, ECG and physical performance measures).

Lab Assays Processed at Framingham Heart Study Laboratory - Clinic Exam, Omni 1 Exam 2. Cholesterol, triglycerides, HDL cholesterol, glucose, and creatinine were measured.
Routine Blood Work Processed at Framingham, Omni 1 Exam 3

Cognitive Function Test - Mini Mental State Exam (MMSE), Original Cohort Exam 17 through Exam 32. The MMSE is a screening tool used to detect deficits/decline in cognitive function. The maximum number of points is 30. Also this is the earliest version of this test.
Fibrinogen - Lab Assay (Blood), Generation 3 Exam 1, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1, and Omni 2 Exam 1

Radius and Tibia Measurements by HR-pQCT, Offspring and New Offspring Spouse, test performed after Offspring Exam 9. This dataset contains distal radius and distal tibia bone microarchitecture data acquired using a high resolution peripheral quantitative computed tomography (HR-pQCT) device.
Diastolic Function (by Doppler), Offspring Exam 8, Generation 3 Exam 1, Omni 1 Exam 3, and Omni 2 Exam 1

Brain MRI: Additional Information on the Area and Circumference of the Anterior and Posterior Commissures of the Brain, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, tests performed between 1999-2015
Hand Bone Lengths by X-ray, Original cohort: Baseline 1967 - 1969, Original cohort: Follow-up 1992 - 1993, Offspring cohort: Baseline 1993 - 1995, and Offspring cohort: Follow-up 2002 - 2003.
Initial CHF Cases Reviewed for Additional Information, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, cases appearing in SOE file (between 1980 and 2013).

Medications Reported at Clinic Exam (ATC coded), Omni 1 Exam 3. This dataset includes medications reported as taken regularly in the past month by Omni 1 Exam 3 study participants, coded with WHO ATC medication codes.
Menopause, Hormone Replacement and Ovary Removal, New Offspring Spouse, cases reviewed through Exam 2
Frequently Used Cardiovascular Risk Factors (a.k.a. "Workthru"), Omni 1 Exam 1 - Exam 4.
Aptamer Proteomic Profiling Lab Assay (Blood), Offspring Exam 5. The aptamer-based SOMAscan proteomics assay was used to investigate 1,129 protein biomarkers for cardiometabolic disease.

Diabetes (Derived), Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, and Omni 2, Exam 1 - Exam 2. Current diabetes status is positive at a specific exam if a study participant reports they are under current treatment for diabetes or they have a blood glucose level of 200 mg/dL or greater. Current diabetes status can change from exam to exam.

Cognitive Function Test -Mini Mental State Exam (MMSE), Offspring Exam 5 - 9 and Omni 1 Exam 1 - 4. The MMSE is a screening tool used to detect deficits/decline in cognitive function. The maximum number of points is 30. Also this is the earliest version of this test.
Medications Reported at Clinic Exam (ATC coded), New Offspring Spouse and Omni 2, Exam 1. Medications were reported by study participants, coded with WHO ATC medication codes.

Bioactive Lipids - Dataset 1 - Eicosanoids - Lab Assay (blood), Offspring Exam 8. For participants with adequate plasma specimens available, mass spectrometry-based measurements of eicosanoids were performed. The eicosanoid data contained in this dataset may be analyzed in conjunction with the Bioactive Lipids Eicosanoids Internal Standards dataset (l_balip1is_ex08_1_1172s).

Bioactive Lipids - Eicosanoids - Dataset 1 - Internal Standards - Lab Assay (blood), Offspring Exam 8. The eicosanoid data contained in this dataset may be analyzed in conjunction with the Bioactive Lipids Eicosanoids dataset (l_balip1_ex08_1_0947s). For participants with adequate plasma specimens available, mass spectrometry-based measurements of eicosanoids were performed.
C-reactive Protein, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1 and Omni 2 Exam 1.

Glials - sCD14 and YKL-40 - Lab Assay (blood), Offspring Exam 9, Omni 1 Exam 4. The project aims to examine the association of serum markers of microglial inflammation (sCD14 and YKL-40) with MRI-defined cerebral small vessel disease (SVD) and its associated neurocognitive and vascular outcomes.
Insulin-like Growth Factor 1 (IGF-1) and Insulin-like Growth Factor Binding Protein 3 (IGFBP-3), Generation 3 Exam 1 and Omni 2 Exam 1.
Fasting Lipid Database Developed across Original Cohort Exams 10 - 12 (a.k.a. lipcoh), Original Exam 10 - Exam 12.

Red Blood Cell Fatty Acid Proportions - Expanded (Lab Assay: Blood), Offspring Exam 7, Offspring Exam 8, and Omni 1 Exam 3. This is an expanded set of fatty acids based on recalled chromatograms. This dataset has rescaled values compared to preceding dataset l_rbcfa_2008_m_0420. This dataset does not replace datataset l_rbcfa_2008_m_0420.
Tau (Lab Assay: Blood), Original Cohort Exam 28, Offspring Exam 8, Generation 3 Exam 2, New Offspring Spouse Exam 2, Omni 1 Exam 3, and Omni 2 Exam 2.
Medications Reported at Clinic Exam, Original Cohort Exams 29, 30 and 31. Medications were reported by study participants, coded with WHO ATC medication codes.

Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) - Self Administered, Original Cohort 2006 - 2009, Offspring 2005 - 2009, and Omni 1 2006 - 2008. CES-D Scale was administered as an additonal Callback questionnaire after Offspring Exam 8 at the Brain MRI Study.

Congestive Heart Failure (CHF) Event Review (Includes Diagnostic Testing Criteria), Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2. The events are reviewed through December 2016. To find the total number of CHF events/cases see "Sequence of Events" file (vr_soe_2016_a_1073s).
Survival and Follow-up Status for Stroke, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2 through 2018. This dataset contains adjudicated/validated endpoints information.

Pulmonary Function Test (PFT) Diffusion, Offspring Exam 9 and Omni 1 Exam 4. Only maneuvers that met acceptability criteria (based on inspired volume, breath hold time, and rapidity of expiration, per ATS/ERS guidelines) were retained in this dataset. Reproducibility of acceptable maneuvers (per ATS/ERS guidelines) was a goal during testing, but all acceptable maneuvers have been retained in this dataset, even if not meeting reproducibility criteria.

Pulmonary Function Test (PFT) Pre Albuterol, Offspring Exam 9 and Omni 1 Exam 4. This spirometry was performed without administration of any inhaler bronchodilator. (In a minority of these subjects, spirometry was repeated after administration of albuterol by inhalation. The post-albuterol spirometry data are contained in a different dataset.)
Pulmonary Function Test (PFT) Pre Albuterol, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1, Omni 2 Exam 1. Spirometry was performed according to the contemporaneous standards of the American Thoracic Society.
Pulmonary Function Test (PFT) Post Albuterol, Offspring Exam 9 and Omni 1 Exam 4. This dataset contains data on post-bronchodilator spirometry measurements.

Cumulative Race and Ethnicity: All Responses between 1994-2008 (self-report), Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, 1994 - 2008. The racial make-up of Original Cohort, Offspring and Generation 3 has been generally described as "almost entirely white" or "white, with very few exceptions." All Original Cohort race and ethnicity were coded as unknown because response data were not available. Offspring Cohort Exam 8 was the first exam where the Offspring Cohort was asked about race and ethnicity. Offspring who did not attend Exam 8 are coded as unknown race and ethnicity. Generation 3, Omni 1, Omni 2 and New Offspring Spouse Cohorts all had an opportunity to respond to race and ethnicity questions.

Pulmonary Function Diffusion Test, Omni 1 Exam 3. Spirometry and diffusing capacity were collected in accordance with contemporaneous American Thoracic Society standards for the measurement of lung function.

Estrone and Estradiol, Generation 3 Exam 1 and Omni 2 Exam 1. Serum estradiol and estrone were measured in women attending Gen 3 Exam 1 (2002-2005). Liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry was used to measure estradiol and estrone levels. The assay sensitivity was 2.5 pg/ml with an inter-assay CV of 14.2%. Samples with low volumes were diluted for measurement with a corresponding decrease in assay sensitivity. For example, a sample requiring a 1:2 dilution would have an assay sensitivity of 5 pg/ml. If the event a measured value was below the limit of detection, the value was replaced with the lower limit of detection.

Sequence of Events (SOE) Cardiovascular Endpoints (Includes Death), Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, events reviewed through 12/2019. There is a more detailed coding manual at the bottom of the SOE protocol for this dataset. Each event is a separate record in this file. If a unique study participant has two or more events with the same date value, the order of events in the dataset does not necessarily reflect the natural order of events. This dataset is generated annually. Included are events reviewed on or before 12/2019. Events reviewed after 12/2019 will appear in the next annual update. Events can take up to two years to be reviewed after they become known. This file does not represent follow up through 12/2019. The corresponding survival file contains follow up information and lags one year behind.

Exam Lab Assays Processed by the Framingham Heart Study Laboratory, Generation 3 Exam 3, New Offspring Spouse Exam 3, and Omni 2 Exam 3. Included in this dataset are measurements from serum, edta plasma, andwhole blood.

DXA Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of the Hip and Spine, New Offspring Spouse(NOS) Exam 2, 2008 - 2011. This is the baseline BMD measurement for the NOS Cohort. BMD was measured at the hip (cleaned regions of interest: femoral neck, trochanter, total hip) and spine (cleaned region of interest: L2-L4).
Omni 1 Clinic Exam 3: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG

Ankle Arm Blood Pressure, Offspring Exam 9 and Omni 1 Exam 4. Participants underwent ankle-brachial blood pressure measurements. Right and left arm systolic blood pressure and right and left posterior tibial systolic blood pressure was recorded in the following order right arm, right ankle, left ankle, left arm. A repeat sequence of measurements was obtained in reverse order: left arm, left ankle, right ankle, right arm. If the posterior tibial pulse could not be located the measurement was obtained from the dorsalis pedis artery.

Ankle Brachial Blood Pressure Measurements, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, and Omni 2, Exam 2. Participants underwent ankle-brachial blood pressure measurements. Right and left arm systolic blood pressure and right and left posterior tibial systolic blood pressure was recorded in the following order right arm, right ankle, left ankle, left arm. A repeat sequence of measurements was obtained in reverse order: left arm, left ankle, right ankle, right arm. If the posterior tibial pulse could not be located the measurement was obtained from the dorsalis pedis artery.

Extra Cellular RNA, Offspring Exam 8. High-throughput sequencing to identify known and as-yet undiscovered circulating exRNAs associated with CVD and preclinical CVD phenotypes, thereby developing a broad panel of plasma-derived exRNA biomarkers (including miRNA, piRNA, noncoding RNAs).
Extra Cellular RNA: Plasma RNA Sequencing Results Pilot, Offspring Exam 8. The criteria for subject inclusion: 20 individuals with CVD, 20 individuals without CVD.

Emphysema by CT (round 2 2008-2011), Offspring and Generation 3. Visual emphysema was assessed from CT lung image analyses. The emphysema subtypes were a priori defined as centrilobular (CLE), paraseptal (PSE), mixed (approximately equal amounts of CLE and PSE), panlobular (PLE) and apical cysts. Participants with emphysema were then classified as having trivial, mild, moderate, marked, and severe disease based upon the degree of parenchymal involvement.

Lab Assay: Red Blood Cell Fatty Acid (blood), Generation 3 and Omni 2 Exam 2. Fatty acid composition was determined with gas chromatography. Results are calculated as the percentage of total fatty acids, compared to a standard mixture of fatty acids characteristic of RBCs.

Negatively Charged Polar Metabolomics - Amide - Installment 1, Generation 3 Exam 1. High throughput metabolite profiling was performed on plasma specimens. The concentration of plasma metabolites was assessed using a liquid chromatography/tandem mass spectrometry (LC/MS/MS) platform with HILIC Amide chromatography. In the dataset, each metabolite value represents the plasma concentration of an analyte (in this case, metabolite) that was assayed. There are a total of 79 metabolites.
Routine Blood Work processed by the Framingham Heart Study Laboratory, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1 and Omni 2 Exam 1. Participants with available biospecimens were included (serum, plasma).

Clinic Exam Data: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, Original Exam 30. Surviving original cohort participants were invited to participate in the 30h follow-up examination. Participants who declined a research clinic visit were offered a visit in their personal residence or nursing home. The examination included a physician-administered medical history interview (or for examinations that occurred outside the research clinic, a technician-administered interview), technician-administered questionnaires to assess cognitive and physical function, and clinical measurements (anthropometrics, ECG and physical performance measures).

Clinic Exam: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, Original Exam 29. Surviving original cohort participants were invited to participate in the 29th follow-up examination. Participants who declined a research clinic visit were offered a visit in their personal residence or nursing home. The examination included a physician-administered medical history interview (or for examinations that occurred outside the research clinic, a technician-administered interview), technician-administered questionnaires to assess cognitive and physical function, and clinical measurements (anthropometrics, ECG and physical performance measures).

Clinic Exam: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, Offspring Exam 9 and Omni 1 Exam 4. Surviving Offspring and Omni Group 1 participants were invited to attend clinic examination 9/4 respectively. Participants who declined a clinic examination were offered a visit in their personal residence or nursing home. The examination included a physician-administered medical history interview (or for examinations that occurred outside the research clinic, a technician-administered interview), technician-administered questionnaires to assess cognitive and physical function, and clinical measurements (anthropometric measurements, ECG and physical performance measures). In addition participants underwent ankle-brachial blood pressure testing and pulmonary function testing. Participants completed self-administered questionnaires that asked about diet, sleep and health.

Insulin, Generation 3 Exam 2, New Offspring Spouse Exam 2, Omni 2 Exam 2. The measurement of fasting serum insulin concentrations was performed in part accomplish aims of red blood cell (RBC) fatty acid analysis and to define the cross-sectional clinical correlates and heritability of RBC n-3 FA content.
Fractures Cases Validated by Medical Records and Other Sources, Generation 3 and Omni 2, fractures through 2018. The fractures in this dataset include adult lifetime hip and non-hip fractures.

Tract-based Spatial Statistics (TBSS) Based on Brain MRI, Offspring and Generation 3, 6/2009 - 6/2014. This dataset contains fractional anisotropy (FA) measures computed from the FA skeletons for 63 JHU WM regions. The values are provided for each hemisphere (left and right) and as the average weighted by the number of voxels per region.

Targeted and Untargeted Metabolomics - HILIC - Installment 1, Generation 3 Exam 1. High throughput metabolite profiling was performed on plasma specimens. The concentration of plasma metabolites was assessed using a liquid chromatography/mass spectrometry (LC/MS) platform and HILIC method. In the dataset, each value represents the plasma concentration of an analyte (in this case, metabolite) that was assayed.

Pulmonary Function Test (PFT) Post Albuterol, Offspring Exam 8 and Omni 1 Exam 3. Only a minority of subjects who performed baseline (pre-bronchodilator) spirometry were asked to perform post-bronchodilator spirometry. This request was made of all subjects whose baseline spirometry demonstrated a FEV1-to-FVC ratio less 0.70.
CT - Iliac Artery Calcification (IAC), Offspring, 2002 - 2005
CT - Pericardial and Extracardial Fat, Offspring, Generation 3, Omni 1, and Omni 2, 9/2008 - 3/2011

Structural Brain Segmentation by MRI Using Freesurfer Software, Offspring Cohort from 2005 - 2010. These include total volume, surface area, gray matter volume, thickness and curvature for the left and right hemispheres. These measures have been assessed by means of two parcellation atlases: Destrieux and Desikan-Killiany.
Lab Assay: Urine Albumin and Urine Creatinine, Offspring Exam 7 and Omni 1 Exam 2

Urine Metabolomics, Offspring Exam 6. This was a nested case control study. All participants were free of CKD at baseline. Half developed CKD at follow-up (exam 8); cases and controls were age-sex matched

Beta Amyloid, Generation 3 Exam 2 and Omni 2 Exam 2. One of the two pathological hallmarks of Alzheimer's Disease (AD) is the presence of amyloid-containing senile plaques; a key component of these plaques is insoluble forms of the beta-amyloid (AB) protein, specifically AB1-42 and AB1-40. Plasma concentrations of AB1-42 and AB1-40 levels were measured using a fluorimetric immunoassay, to evaluate the clinical correlates, and to assess the prognostic significance in AD and its precursor, mild cognitive impairment (MCI). The limit of detection for this assay is 12pg/ml for AB1-40 and 5pg/ml for AB1-42. All assays were run on a single lot.

Neuropsychological Battery Dates, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2. NP Battery was performed from 01/1982 to 12/2019. This dataset provides a study participant listing of all neuropsychological battery test dates. A schedule was maintained of study participants who underwent the battery. This schedule formed the basis for this dataset.

Covert Brain Infarct (CBI) by Brain MRI, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, MRI performed 3/1999 to 12/2013. The Covert Brain Infarct (CBI) dataset contains the details of the infarct size, location, side, and type for participants who had CBI.

Brain MRI Dates, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2. MRI was performed from 3/1999 to 12/2019. This dataset provides a study participant listing of brain MRI test dates. A schedule was maintained of study participants who had a brain MRI. This schedule formed the basis for this dataset.

Framingham Heart Study CT Scan Dates (Round 1 and Round 2), Offspring and Generation 3, Omni 1, and Omni 2, 6/2002 - 3/2011. This dataset contains the CT scan Dates for CT scans performed on Framingham Heart Study participants.
CT - Liver Fat, Offspring, Generation 3, Omni 1, and Omni 2, 9/2008 - 3/2011

Airway Measurements Based on CT Lung Images (CT Round 2), Offspring, Generation 3, Omni 1, and Omni 2, 2008-2011. A subset of the Offspring and Generation 3 cohorts underwent gated whole lung CT imaging with the primary goal of assessing coronary artery calcification.

Omni 1 Clinic Exam 1: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG. When the Omni 1 cohort was initiated, their first exam coincided with Offspring Exam 5. Hence, the Offspring Exam 5 form (with some modifications) was used for the Omni 1 Exam 1 clinic visit.

Measurement from CT Image of the Thoracic Aortic Calcifications (TAC), Offspring and Generation 3, 6/2002 - 4/2005

Physical Activity Monitor (Actical®), Offspring Exam 9, Omni 1 Exam 4. The Actical physical activity monitor was administered at both the Offspring Exam 9 clinic exam (t_physactf_ex09_1b_0833s) and also at the Generation 3 Exam 2 clinic exam (t_physactf_ex02_3b_0914s). The Offspring Exam 9 study participants were instructed to take the monitor off during sleep, whereas the Generation 3 Exam 2 study participants were instructed to sleep with the monitor on. As a result, the two datasets may not be comparable for some measures. It is advisable to take this difference into account when analyzing the data.

Brain MRI - White Matter Hyperintensity, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, performed from 6/1999 to 11/2017. This dataset contains post mortem brain MRIs. This dataset replaces t_mrbrnm2_2013_a_0958s and t_mrbrnm1u_2011_m_0972s.

Metabolomics - HILIC (Installment 3), Offspring Exam 5. High throughput metabolite profiling was performed on plasma specimens collected from individuals in the Framingham Offspring cohort attending Examination 5. This dataset includes measurements made on blood specimens (pre-OGTT) that were collected from Offspring Cohort participants who attended Examination 5. The concentration of plasma metabolites was assessed using a liquid chromatography / mass spectrometry (LC/MS) platform. In the dataset, each value represents the plasma concentration of an analyte that was assayed. This dataset represents the third 'installment' of the Offspring Exam 5 assays. To get a complete set of observations, combine this dataset with l_mtbli1_ex05_0610s and l_mtbli2_ex05_1_0660s.

Echocardiography: Cardiac Strain, Offspring Exam 8. Speckle tracking stain based analyses were performed on digitally recorded 2D images collected from participants who attended Offspring examination 8 and underwent standardized echocardiography. Speckle tracking based measures were performed on a total of three image views per participant: apical 2 chamber view (a2ch), apical 4 chamber view (a4ch), and the parasternal short axis view at the papillary muscle level (sax-pm). All measures were performed using the Cardiac Performance Analysis software package (TomTec Imaging, Germany).

High Sensitivity Cardiac Troponin 1 (cTnl), Generation 3 Exam 1 and Omni 2 Exam 1. hsTnI concentrations were measured at Singulex with a high sensitivity immunoassay for cardiac troponin I, utilizing a novel, single-molecule counting technology (Erenna hsTnI, Singulex).

Interstitial Lung Abnormalities (acquired from round 2 CT scans), Offspring and Generation 3 Cohorts, CT scans performed between 9/2008 to 3/2011. A subset of the Offspring and Generation 3 cohorts underwent gated whole lung CT imaging with the primary goal of assessing coronary artery calcification.

Vitamin B12, Folate and Vitamin B6 (PLP), Generation 3 Exam 1. This dataset represents a subset of those Generation 3 participants who came in for Exam 1. This subset represents those participants who also received a CT scan. The Framingham Osteoporosis Study, an ancillary study of the Framingham Heart Study, has contributed substantially to the understanding of risk factors for age-related bone loss and fractures in men and women. One of the study aims is to investigate the relationship between vitamin B12, B6, and folate status and volumetric trabecular bone mineral density measured on CT scans from participants enrolled in the Framingham Heart Study Offspring and Third Generation Multidetector CT Study, (Framingham CT Study) and their interactions with candidate genes in common methylation pathways. Plasma EDT samples collected at Cycle 1 for the 3rd Generation participants. Vitamin B12/Folate were measured from October 2009 through May 2010. Pyridoxal phosphate (also known as PLP or B6) was analyzed from August through December 2010. Methyl malonic acid, (MMA) measurements will be added once completed.

Human Stromal Cell-derived Factor 1 Alpha (SDF-1), Offspring Exam 6. This study includes immunoassay-generated data for plasma stromal cell derived factor-1a (SDF-1) from Exam 6 of Offspring cohort participants. Characterizing robust biomarkers associated with CVD is necessary for the discovery of disease mechanisms and development of diagnostics. Previous studies suggest that SDF-1 is a highly promising biomarker of CVD. SDF-1 is a CXC chemokine that mediates the immune response by regulating lymphocytes, monocytes, and B-cell proliferation. Variants in the SDF-1 gene CXCL12 are associated with plasma SDF-1 levels. We hypothesize that circulating SDF-1 levels are associated with atherosclerotic CVD. For these reasons, we measured plasma SDF-1 levels using an ELISA-based assay from R and D Systems, Inc., Minneapolis, MN, Part #DSA00, http://www.rndsystems.com/pdf/dsa00.pdf. The assay is a 4.5 hour solid-phase ELISA, which measures human SDF-1alpha in platelet-poor plasma. EDTA plasma samples from Exam 6 of Offspring cohort participants were stored at -80C and used immediately after thawing. 3532 Offspring participants completed Exam 6. After exclusion criteria were applied, 3336 measurements qualified for data analysis. These measurements are included in this dataset.

Red Blood Cell Fatty Acids, Offspring Exam 8 and Omni 1 Exam 3. This study involved the analysis of red blood cell fatty acid composition in samples taken at Exam 8 (Offspring). The goals were to determine the cross sectional relations between the RBC omega-3 fatty acid levels (the Omega-3 Index) and markers of CVD risk, and to determine the extent to which the Omega-3 index predicted risk for future CVD events. These data were also used to examine cross sectional relations with brain volume and cognitive function (Tan et al., 2012).
Metabolomics - Lipid Platform (Installment 2), Offspring Exam 5.

Metabolomics - HILIC (Installment 2), Offspring Exam 5. High throughput metabolite profiling was performed on plasma specimens collected from individuals in the Framingham Offspring cohort attending Examination 5. This dataset includes measurements made on blood specimens (pre-OGTT) that were collected from Offspring Cohort participants who attended Examination 5. The concentration of plasma metabolites was assessed using a liquid chromatography / mass spectrometry (LC/MS) platform. In the dataset, each value represents the plasma concentration of an analyte that was assayed. This dataset represents the second 'installment' of the Offspring Exam 5 assays. To get a complete set of observations, combine this dataset with l_mtbli1_ex05_0610s and l_mtbli3_ex05_1_0707s.

Central Metabolomics - HILIC (Installment 1), Offspring Exam 5. High throughput metabolite profiling was performed on plasma specimens collected from individuals in the Framingham Offspring cohort attending Examination 5. This dataset includes measurements made on blood specimens (pre-OGTT) that were collected from a subset of the Offspring Cohort participants who attended Examination 5 (and were selected for inclusion in nested case-control studies of incident diabetes and cardiovascular disease). The concentration of plasma metabolites was assessed using a liquid chromatography / mass spectrometry (LC/MS) platform and HILIC method. In the dataset, each value represents the plasma concentration of an analyte (in this case, metabolite) that was assayed. This dataset represents the first installment of the Offspring Exam 5 assays. The balance of the Offspring Exam 5 assays will be processed at a later date (and therefore will reside in another dataset). This dataset must be combined with the following dataset(s) to get a complete set of observations: l_mtblcmhi2_ex05_1_0708s.
CERAD / Stroop Exclusion Data, Generation 3 Cohort Exam 2. This dataset contains possible exclusion information to be used with the Generation 3 CERAD / Stroop dataset vr_ceradstr_ex02_3_0807.

Galectin-3, Offspring Exam 6. Galectin-3 measurements were performed on stored Framingham Offspring cohort EDTA plasma samples from the sixth examination cycle (1995-1998). Samples were measured using an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (BG Medicine, Waltham, MA, USA). The lower detection limit of the assay is 1.32 ng/ml with an upper detection limit of 96.6 ng/ml (for a detailed description of the galectin-3 assay, please see reference by Christenson RH, Clin Biochem, 2010).

Physical Exam and Disorders of the Foot, Original and Offspring Cohorts December 2000 and June 2008. Participants are limited to those who attended Original Cohort Exams 27-28 and Offspring Exam 8. The Framingham Foot Study, an ancillary study of the FHS, is an observational cohort study of adults to examine the role of foot disorders upon functional limitations and disability. Foot disorders were assessed using a validated Foot Assessment Clinical Tool that captures the main features of common foot disorders. Reliability of this instrument has been shown to be excellent [Hannan et al., 2001; Hannan et al., 2003]. Briefly, trained clinical examiners conducted a physical examination of a participant's feet, collected data on medical history, plantar pressures using a computerized mat, and administered risk assessment questionnaires. Specific disorders of interest included hallux valgus, toe deformities other than hallux (lesser toe deformities of hammer toes, claw toes and overlapping toes), heel fat-pad atrophy, fore fat-pad atrophy, pes cavus, and pes planus. Information relevant to foot pain was also collected in the questionnaire. The structural foot disorders were indicated as present or absent based on an atlas of pictorial depictions of each foot disorder. For example, heel fat-pad atrophy, this condition was indicated as present or absent based on palpitation of the plantar heel of each foot. If bony prominences were noted at this area with minimal pressure then atrophy was considered present (to indicate decreased fat/muscle mass on the bottom of the heel).
Quadriceps Strength, Generation 3 Exam 2. The dataset includes quadriceps strength measures from Generation 3 Exam 2 participants, who joined the Osteoporosis Study (2008 - 2011).
Osteoprotegerin, Offspring Exam 8 and Omni 1 Exam 3

Echocardiogram: Standard Right Ventricular Measures, Offspring Exam 8 and Omni 1 Exam 3. For actual test dates, please refer to the echocardiogram test date in the dataset: t_echo_2008_m_0549s. For participants with adequate quality 2-dimensional images acquired in the apical 4-chamber view, post-hoc standardized measurements of right-sided chambers were performed. These measurements include quantification of right ventricular size and right atrial size.

Pulmonary Function Test Diffusion, Generation 3 Exam 2, New Offspring Spouse Exam 2, and Omni 2 Exam 2. Subjects performed two maneuvers to measure diffusion capacity. If the first two maneuvers were not acceptable and reproducible, a third maneuver was performed. Only maneuvers that met acceptability criteria (based on inspired volume, breath hold time, and rapidity of expiration, per ATS/ERS guidelines) were retained in this dataset.

Pulmonary Function Test (PFT) Pre Albuterol, Generation 3 Exam 2, New Offspring Spouse Exam 2, and Omni 2 Exam 2. This dataset contains data on pre-bronchodilator spirometry without administration of any inhaler bronchodilator. Acceptable maneuvers were used for deriving the highest FEV1, highest FVC, and other spirometry measurements included in this dataset.

Pulmonary Function Test (PFT) Post Albuterol, Generation 3 Exam 2, New Offspring Spouse Exam 2, and Omni 2 Exam 2. Only a minority of subjects who performed baseline (pre-bronchodilator) spirometry were asked to perform post-bronchodilator spirometry. This request was made of all subjects whose baseline spirometry demonstrated EITHER a FEV1-to-FVC ratio less than 90 % of the predicted value OR a FEV1 less than 85 % of the predicted value.

Survival - Atrial Fibrillation/Flutter - Validated by Medical Records, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2 through 2018. This dataset contains validated endpoints information and should be used in conjunction with the corresponding AF file - in this case dataset vr_afcum_2019_a_1186s.

Physical Activity Scale for Elderly (PASE), Generation 3 Exam 2. Participants were those who completed the Osteoporosis Study questionnaire (2008 - 2011). Detailed methodology of how to obtain and calculate PASE scores can be found in Washburn RA, et al., 1993, and Smith KW, 1991.

Central Metabolomics - HILIC (Installment 2), Offspring Exam 5. High throughput metabolite profiling was performed on plasma specimens collected from individuals in the Framingham Offspring cohort attending Examination 5. This dataset includes measurements made on blood specimens (pre-OGTT) that were collected from Offspring Cohort participants who attended Examination 5 (and were selected for inclusion in nested case-control studies of incident diabetes and cardiovascular disease). The concentration of plasma metabolites was assessed using a liquid chromatography / mass spectrometry (LC/MS) platform and HILIC method. In the dataset, each value represents the plasma concentration of an analyte (in this case, metabolite) that was assayed. This dataset represents the second installment of the Offspring Exam 5 assays. This dataset must be combined with the following dataset(s) to get a complete set of observations: l_mtblcmhi1_ex05_1_0662s.

CERAD and Victoria Stroop Neurocognitive Questionnaire, Generation 3 Exam 2. This dataset contains calculated score variables for the CERAD and STROOP tests. Please see the protocol for explanations of how variables were calculated. Exclusion criteria for this dataset are located in vr_crdstrex_ex02_3_0821s.

Echocardiography, Offspring Exam 8, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1, Omni 1 Exam 3, and Omni 2 Exam 1. Echocardiography (ultrasound of the heart) provides a noninvasive assessment of cardiac structure and function. Echocardiographic cardiac structure and function data provide important knowledge of the prevalence, predictors, and prognosis of cardiovascular disease (CVD).

Sigma Power in Sleep (EEG), Original, Offspring, and Omni 1, tests performed between 1995 and 1998. The purpose of this study is to identify genetic variation in the normal human population that is associated with variation in sleep spindle characteristics. In order to estimate sleep spindle activity in individuals from the FHS, a power spectral analysis was performed on epochs that were scored as stage 2 sleep. All FHS subjects with nocturnal polysomnography data including EEG polysomnogram were included. For subjects with multiple polysomnograms, only the first polysomnogram was used.

Echo Mitral Valve Prolapse (MVP) Progression, Offspring Exam 5. This data table includes measurements of the mitral valve leaflet height, thickness and projection, annular dimensions, regurgitation jet height, coadaptation height, and displacement in two-dimensional views or on M-mode echocardiography.
Tumor Necrosis Factor Receptor II, Offspring Exam 8 and Omni 1 Exam 3
Monocyte Chemotactic Protein 1 (MCP-1), Offspring Exam 8, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1, and Omni 1 Exam 3.

Lipoprotein-associated phospholipase A2 (Lp-PLA2) Activity and Mass, Offspring Exams 7 and 8, and Omni 1 Exam 3. This set contains duplicate records. Some of the same Offspring participants were done with both exam 7 and exam 8 samples. Some Offspring exam 8 participants were done in duplicate because of the use of phantom samples for QC purposes. The phantom samples can be found by using those records that are not blank for the variable PHANTOM_ID. See variable-associated notes for more details.
Interleukin-6, Offspring Exam 8, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1, Omni 1 Exam 3
Intercellular Adhesion Molecule 1 (ICAM-1), Offspring Exam 8, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1, and Omni 1 Exam 3

Cerebral Micro Bleeds (CMB) by Head MRI, Original and Offspring, scans done from 12/2000 - 6/2009. This dataset corresponds to the follow-up MRI for the CS2 cycle. This dataset only includes participants who have information on cerebral micro bleed status, not all participants who had an MRI for CS2. There are some participants who only completed scans in the CS2 cycle and did not have the baseline CS1 scan.

CT of Spine Assessing Spondylolysis, Spondylolisthesis and Spinal Stenosis, Offspring and Generation 3 Cohorts, scans done between 2002-2005. This dataset represents a random sample of Offspring and Generation 3 cohort participants who had CT scans performed between 2002 and 2005. This ancillary study is a cross sectional evaluation of lumbar spinal degeneration using MDCT scans already collected for the Offspring and Generation 3 cohorts of the Framingham Heart Study. We will use this existing data to examine the prevalence of lumbar spinal degenerative features, and associations with pain and functional limitations, in a sample of individuals who underwent MDCT scans. We will also examine relationships between aortic calcifications as a marker of vascular disease, and the occurrence of lumbar spinal degeneration, as well as associated symptoms and functional limitations.

Survival and Follow-up Status for CHF, CVD and CHD, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2 through 2018. This dataset includes follow-up time for the following events: CVD, CHD, CHF, Stroke and Stroke/TIA.

CT Lung Measurements (Round 2), Offspring and Generation 3 Cohorts. These measurements were done on the second round of CT scans, where the scan was optimal for lung measurements. The CT scans were completed from 9/2008 to 3/2011.

Lab Assays Processed at Framingham Heart Study Laboratory - Clinic Exam, Generation 3 Exam 2, New Offspring Spouse Exam 2, and Omni 2 Exam 2. Laboratory methods for some variables changed over the course of the exam cycle. Please refer to the protocol (phs4087.v1 l_fhslab_2011_m_0656_protocol.docx) for an explanation. The following measures were obtained: 1) Whole blood - HbA1c, basophil count and percent, eosinophil count and percent, hematocrit, hemoglobin, lymphocyte count and percent, MCH, MCHC, MCV, monocyte count and percent, MPV, neutrophil count and percent, platelet count, RBC, RDW, and WBC; 2) EDTA plasma - total cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, triglycerides, glucose, and post-glucose; 3) Serum - creatinine, albumin, ALT, AST, bilirubin, calcium, CRP, GGT, and phosphorus; 4) albumin and creatinine.
C-Reactive Protein (CRP), Offspring Exam 8 and Omni 1 Exam 3

CT Lung Measures, Offspring and Generation 3, 2002 - 2005. The dataset includes information obtained from the densitometric analysis performed on the cardiac CT scans in the Framingham Heart Study for Offspring and Gen 3 cohorts who underwent computed tomography scans between 2002 and 2005. For this investigation, the lungs were segmented from the chest and both lung volume and the histogram distribution of lung density were calculated with the primary goal of assessing coronary artery calcification. It is corresponding to Cycle 7 clinic examination for Offspring and Cycle 1 for Gen 3.
8-EPI-Isoprostane in Urine, Offspring Exam 8 and Omni 1 Exam 3
8-EPI-Isoprostane in Urine, Generation 3 Exam 1 and Omni 1 Exam 1

Insulin-like Growth Factor-1 (IGF-1), Offspring Exam 7. Blood was drawn after an overnight fast, immediately centrifuged and stored at -70C until biomarkers were assayed. ELISA assays were run on stored sera using standard commercially available kits (from R&D, Inc.) for Insulin-like Growth Factor-1 (IGF-1) using kits from R&D., Inc.

Echocardiography, Generation 3 Exam 1. Echocardiography (ultrasound of the heart) provides a noninvasive assessment of cardiac structure and function. Echocardiographic cardiac structure and function data provide important knowledge of the prevalence, predictors, and prognosis of cardiovascular disease (CVD).

Survival - All-cause Mortality, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2 through 2018. This dataset includes follow-up time for the following events: all-cause CVD mortality.

Dementia Diagnosis Consensus Reviews, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, Omni 2, cases reviewed through 2018. This dataset contains dementia review endpoints. This dataset replaces dataset vr_cogstadr_2016_a_1094s.

Neuropsychology Test Scores, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, 1982 - 2018. The primary objective of the MRI and Cognitive study was to establish baseline measures of brain morphology and cognitive function in the Original cohort survivors. This dataset contains all NP measures for participants in any of the FHS cohorts. The study comprised of a 50-90 minute neuropsychological test battery that also included some measures of physical functioning. This is NOT an adjudicated diagnosis and should not be used as such in ANY analysis under any circumstance. Please refer to the dementia review dataset for adjudicated dementia diagnosis outcomes.
Large Artery Tonometry, Generation 3 Exam 2, Omni 2 Exam 2, and New Offspring Spouse Exam 2.

Cognitive Test Scores: CERAD, Stroop, AD8 and MOCA, Generation 3 Exam 3, New Offspring Spouse Exam 3, and Omni 2 Exam 3. Participants who attended this examination were administered a neuropsychological evaluation, which included the Consortium to Establish a Registry for Alzheimer's Disease word list task (CERAD-WL), Victoria Stroop Test (VST), Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) and Dementia Screening Interview (AD8) batteries, to evaluate cognitive performance and establish baseline normative data for non-demented young adults.

Dementia Survival Information for All Cohorts, Original, Offspring, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, Omni 1, and Omni 2, survival through 2018. This dataset replaces datasets: vr_demne_2016_a_1087s, vr_demnp_2016_a_1088s, vr_cogflag_2016_a_1086s, and vr_cogstadr_2016_a_1094s.

Food Frequency Questionnaire and Derived Variables, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1. Participants completed the Harvard semi-quantitative food frequency questionnaire (FFQ) designed to obtain information about what they typically eat and drink.

Diabetes Related Assays - Lab Assay (Blood), Offspring Exams 5, 6, 7 and Omni 1 Exams 1, 2. These include measurement of blood hemoglobin A1c, insulin, proinsulin, adiponectin, resistin, TNF-alpha and urine microalbumin, creatinine, and sodium levels. This dataset replaces datasets: adi1_7s, hba1_7s, inshba1_5s, insulin1_7s, tnfa1_7s, postins1_7, ogtt1_7, and urine1_6s.

Pulmonary Function Diffusion Test, New Offspring Spouse and Omni 2, Exam 1. Spirometry and diffusing capacity were collected in accordance with contemporaneous American Thoracic Society standards for the measurement of lung function.

Food Frequency Questionnaire with Derived Variables, Generation 3 Exam 2. Variables that have FFQ at the beginning of the variable description are those questions on the actual FFQ questionnaire and answered by the participant. Variables that are described as derived fields were calculated using the answers to the FFQ questions.

Clinic Exam: Interview, Physical Exam, ECG, Generation 3, New Offspring Spouse, and Omni 2, Exam 2. The inclusion criteria for this dataset is at least 19 years old at Exam 1, at least one parent in the Framingham Heart Study, signed BUMC IRB consent at exam 1 for participation in the FHS Third Generation exam and participation in FHS genetic research.

Methylmalonic Acid (MMA), Generation 3 Exam 1. This assay was performed on Generation 3 Exam 1 study participants who had a bone mineral density measured by CT and available plasma samples at Exam 1. This dataset is part of the ancillary study Framingham Osteoporosis Study (FOS). Individuals with homocystinuria, a biochemical abnormality causing elevated plasma Hcy concentrations, have an increased prevalence of osteoporosis. This observation suggested that milder elevations of Hcy may have adverse effects on bone. A recent study by our group found that elevated plasma Hcy concentration was associated with a two to four-fold increased risk of hip fracture in community-dwelling elders. These results were confirmed in the Rotterdam Study for all fractures. None of these studies, however, were able to establish a causal mechanism for the effect of Hcy on fracture. Thus, it is still unclear whether or not Hey directly affects bone strength or is an innocent bystander. Potential candidates for the true causative factor may lie along the pathway of Hcy metabolism. Hcy is metabolized through two metabolic pathways: remethylation and transsulfuration. In remethylation, Hcy is converted to methionine by the donation of a methyl group from 5-mehtyltetrahydrofolate, the main circulating form of folate. 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is synthesized from 5, 10-methylenetetrahydrofolate by the enzyme methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase (MTHFR). The remethylation of Hey to methionine is catalyzed by the enzyme methionine synthase (MTR). which is activated by the vitamin B12-dependent enzyme methionine synthase reductase (MTRR). Through the trans-sulfuration pathway, Hey is converted to cystathionine in a reaction catalyzed by the vitamin B6-containing enzyme cystathionine (3-synthase (CBS). Thus the aim of this study is to test the association between common variants in the above four genes and volumetric BMD of the spine and to test for an interaction between common variants in these four genes and levels of B12, MMA, folate and B6 on volumetric BMD of the spine.

Bone Mineral Density of Hip and Spine, Offspring, Scans done from January 2002 through July 2008. This dataset includes Offspring participants who participated in the Osteoporosis Study Offspring Exam 7.5 (2002 - 2005) and/or Exam 8 Callback Osteoporosis Exam (2005 - 2008), though some may have participated only in either the Exam 7.5 or Exam 8 callback.

P wave measurements, Original Cohort Exam 20, Offspring Exam 6, and Generation 3 Exam 1. The Framingham Heart Study ECG Repository has been developed to examine electrocardiographic traits employing digitized tracings analyzed on the General Electric MUSE 8.

Medications Reported at Clinic Exam, Generation 3 Exam 2, New Offspring Spouse Exam 2, and Omni 2 Exam 2. Participants were mailed a medication bag with a request to bring in all prescription and non-prescription medication to the clinic. The physician recorded all the medications during the clinic visit. These medications were then coded using the World Health Organization's Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) classifications. Information about the ATC classification system can be found at http://www.whocc.no/atcddd/. See protocol document for more details.

Clinic Exam Dates, Sex, Age at Exam, Original Exam 1 - Exam 32, Offspring Exam 1 - Exam 9, Generation 3 Exam 1 - Exam 3, New Offspring Spouse Exam 1 - Exam 3, Omni 1 Exam 1 - Exam 4, and Omni 2 Exam 1 - Exam 3. The time interval is from 1948 through 2019. The age at each clinic exam was calculated using the clinic exam date and the date of birth. Clinic exam dates were calculated using the number of days between exam 1 and subsequent exams.
Psychosocial Scales, Original Cohort Exams 8, 9, and 10. This dataset contains the rating of the respondent's behavior in the interview in regard to: Cooperativeness.

Beta Amyloid, Original Cohort Exam 23, Offspring Exam 7, and Omni 1 Exam 2. One of the two pathological hallmarks of Alzheimer's Disease (AD) is the presence of amyloid-containing senile plaques; a key component of these plaques is insoluble forms of the beta-amyloid (AB) protein, specifically AB1-42 and AB1-40. Plasma concentrations of AB1-42 and AB1-40 levels were measured using a fluorimetric immunoassay, to evaluate the clinical correlates, and to assess the prognostic significance in AD and its precursor, mild cognitive impairment (MCI). The limit of detection for this assay is 12pg/ml for AB1-40 and 5pg/ml for AB1-42. All assays were run on a single lot.
Pulmonary Function Test (PFT) Pre Albuterol, Omni 1 Exam 3. This dataset was processed in a manner consistent with contemporaneous American Thoracic Standards.
Pulmonary Function Test, Omni 1 Exam 1. This dataset was processed in a manner consistent with contemporaneous American Thoracic Standards.
